commit_message:
Add exec_instances to data model

Zun is going to implement a proxy for interactive execute.
The first step is to introduce data model for tracking each
exec instances of a container. An exec instance in Zun is
an one-to-one mapping for exec instance in Docker.
We will use it to track a docker's exec instance as well as
a generated token for granting access of this exec instance.
In the future, the websocket proxy will retrieve the token from
incoming request and match it to the one stored in DB.
The request will be rejected if the token doesn't match.

This patch introduces the data model of exec_instance
in DB api and objects layer. It basically contains three
fields: container_id, exec_id, url, token.
The container_id is the id of the container record in Zun.
The exec_id is the ID of the docker's exec instance.
The url is the docker daemon endpoint for the exec instance
The token is as described above.

Partial-Bug: #1735076
Change-Id: Ib38a46c0e3f3aae58e1f562536b858bc4cd23bf8

commit_message:
Use correct package for CentOS rndc

The package for rndc comes in bind and not in bind-utils under
CentOS.

Change-Id: Id25d0490e09b32997b02ad1dfe264c7dab6e57d4

Instead of parsing os-net-config, we should be running this script for
all the unmanaged devices. The 99-origin-dns.sh script doesn't care

commit_message:
Run dispatch script for all unmanaged devices

Instead of parsing os-net-config, we should be running this script for
all the unmanaged devices. The 99-origin-dns.sh script doesn't care
whether the device is managed by NM or not, what it cares about is
whether the device is the one used for the default route.

Change-Id: I2cc0bc8179c51222616706aceaa99112af4c3fd8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 16:03:34.000000000', 'message': 'Use the standard messaging in the baremetal workbook

Update the baremetal workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

This is a continuation of I1665ae56a88557bdb8459651021185cfb9fd1a8f.
Some old-style messaging was added after the refactor and some redundant
lines were not removed.

Change-Id: Ieeabe23ffe134cf19634b4b052805ae7165f34e6
Related-Bug: #1757372
'}]
commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the baremetal workbook

Update the baremetal workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

This is a continuation of I1665ae56a88557bdb8459651021185cfb9fd1a8f.
Some old-style messaging was added after the refactor and some redundant
lines were not removed.

Change-Id: Ieeabe23ffe134cf19634b4b052805ae7165f34e6
Related-Bug: #1757372

Closes-Bug: 1777432
'}]
commit_message:
Use coordination to prevent duplicate pricing

Use MySQL as coordination backend for cloudkitty-processors.
Otherwise prices may get calculated multiple times.

Change-Id: I661ca3b7ffb4f64242422297bafc938ca5082a12
Closes-Bug: 1777432

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 02:34:39.000000000', 'message': 'Drop LXC development headers

We no longer install the Python LXC bindings from source therefore we
do not need to be installing the packages for it.  In the case of
CentOS, we also avoid going pulling a dependency from EPEL.

Change-Id: I287a7209d7840283e374a8bb14d9caa4f714baf0
'}, {'created': '2018-06-19 03:21:04.000000000', 'message': "redhat: Add the EPEL repository for moreutils packages

The moreutils package is needed from EPEL so we install it inside
the role. Moreover, in order to minimize the potential EPEL vs RDO
package conflicts, we only allow a small subset of packages from the
EPEL repository. Finally, we include the nodepool playbook from the
tests repository in order to populate the necessary CI facts.

Also, we don't need the LXC development headers so drop them.

Change-Id: I287a7209d7840283e374a8bb14d9caa4f714baf0
"}, {'created': '2018-06-19 13:38:58.000000000', 'message': "redhat: Add the EPEL repository for moreutils packages

The moreutils package is needed from EPEL so we install it inside
the role. Moreover, in order to minimize the potential EPEL vs RDO
package conflicts, we only allow a small subset of packages from the
EPEL repository. Finally, we include the nodepool playbook from the
tests repository in order to populate the necessary CI facts.

Also, we don't need the LXC development headers so drop them.

Change-Id: I287a7209d7840283e374a8bb14d9caa4f714baf0
"}]
commit_message:
redhat: Add the EPEL repository for moreutils packages

The moreutils package is needed from EPEL so we install it inside
the role. Moreover, in order to minimize the potential EPEL vs RDO
package conflicts, we only allow a small subset of packages from the
EPEL repository. Finally, we include the nodepool playbook from the
tests repository in order to populate the necessary CI facts.

Also, we don't need the LXC development headers so drop them.

Change-Id: I287a7209d7840283e374a8bb14d9caa4f714baf0

commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the stack workbook

Update the stack workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

Change-Id: I2bf3b0eea591969892d8c98937f62719c4e02361
Related-Bug: #1757372

commit_message:
Updated murano configuration

 - keystone_authtoken section seems to require both new and old user
   parameters for import of Core Library and authentication respectively

 - murano-engine requires rabbitmq configuration

Closes-Bug: #1631333

Change-Id: Ia1cc70994841beb0fbb764c0d4bf6cad2d9afcf8

commit_message:
Make the hash of a defaulted set field stable

The string representation of an empty set is different between py27 and
py35. The ObjectVersionChecker uses the string represenation of the
default value of the fields as input for the hash of the object. This
makes hash of an object with a set field defaulted to an empty set
unstable.

This patch enhances the repr generation of the Field object to avoid the
unstable hash situation.

Change-Id: Ie9519c1893175614d60af97b635e6ff57f2b0d7d
Closes-Bug: #1771804

subject: Fix common/test_utils.py on Python 3.5.4+
messages:
[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-24 21:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2018-06-18 23:22:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm all for this. It was annoying me too, started happening on Fedora 27. The fix is precisely what I wanted to make. Well, I meant to check that the length is either 1 or 2, too. But this is fine."}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-06-20 03:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-24 21:29:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix common/test_utils.py on Python 3.5.4+

In CPython commit e59af55c2, instantiating a logging.SysLogHandler
stopped raising an exception if the syslog server was
unavailable. This commit first appears in CPython
3.5.4. utils.get_logger() catches that error and retries the
instantiation, and there a test asserting that. The test fails on
Python 3.5.4 or greater, so now it has been corrected to only assert
things about the first instantiation of logging.SysLogHandler and
passes on Python 3.5.4 and 3.5.5.

This was noticed by running "tox -e py35" on an Ubuntu 18.04 system,
which ships with Python 3.5.5.

Change-Id: I43f231bd7d3566b9849a48f46ec9e2af4cd23be4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix common/test_utils.py on Python 3.5.4+

In CPython commit e59af55c2, instantiating a logging.SysLogHandler
stopped raising an exception if the syslog server was
unavailable. This commit first appears in CPython
3.5.4. utils.get_logger() catches that error and retries the
instantiation, and there a test asserting that. The test fails on
Python 3.5.4 or greater, so now it has been corrected to only assert
things about the first instantiation of logging.SysLogHandler and
passes on Python 3.5.4 and 3.5.5.

This was noticed by running "tox -e py35" on an Ubuntu 18.04 system,
which ships with Python 3.5.5.

Change-Id: I43f231bd7d3566b9849a48f46ec9e2af4cd23be4

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I2a9853b52f23fc4b6a24a0548b9749e976467758
(cherry picked from commit 1b99782821cc95fa0d3bec6a9a4ec1cff6b2bed2)

docs: Add Patrole overview documentation

This patchset adds a Patrole overview documentation
section which is sorely needed. It combines the previous
usage documentation into it.

Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python 3

The previous version returned a byte string, which caused errors on
Python 3.  I borrowed the fix from [1].

commit_message:
Add .rst files check to pep8

Errors in README.rst prevent the package from being registered in Pypi. We would like pep8 to fail in these cases.
For more details, see: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131233.html

Change-Id: Ic6f92abd09740372a829b9a58902e1c8f63b5bcc

commit_message:
Allow specifying name of related resource when creation

This commit allows the followings:
  1. using runtime name when creating functions
  2. using function name when creating executions, function versions,
     jobs and webhooks

This makes it easier to use the client. However, please note that this
is not very efficient due to the finding mechanism which should later be
improved.

Change-Id: I14e47f5aa53418533d42629f6f0c5c3d6639bdbc

commit_message:
Add examples and clarification around scope_types

When we initially implemented the scope_types attribute, we included
some documentation but we never explicitly described how to use
scope_types, what was officially supported, or why the attribute is
important.

This commit attempts to add documentation that clarifies those areas.

Change-Id: I46d351b3c9888a703d520082f10ebbedc53973ff
Closes-Bug: 1771621

commit_message:
Fix Context test cases

oslo.context has added a new key 'system_scope" and hence some of the
unit tests are failing as it asserts on the entire contents of the
dict. Modified all such unit tests and now it only asserts on
masakari-specific keys in the context.

This patch removes test_convert_from_dict_to_dict_version_2_4_x unit
test as Masakari is using oslo.context>=2.19.2.

Change-Id: I3252ef742f5dd4cb446b1dd6cd887e42f2a9d729
Signed-off-by: Sampath Priyankara <sam47priya@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Neha Alhat <neha.alhat@nttdata.com>

commit_message:
Mark the HGST Driver unsupported

The HGST driver has not run 3rd Party CI
in more than 60 days.  This patch marks it
unsupported and it will be removed in Stein
if the 3rd Party CI Issues are not resolved.

Change-Id: I43dba479dad98a397b5134bbc42922764350858e

commit_message:
Updates Launchpad references to Storyboard

Updates references to Launchpad to now point to Storyboard, since OSH has
migrated to that platform.  "Report a bug" type references are updated to
point straight to the OSH project proper in Storyboard, while general backlog
type references are updated to point to the OSH Project Group.

Change-Id: I63e290f34763847e71e14e4471e7ee9460d8cff9
Task: 21684
Story: 2002199

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:37.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia481330b9a889b113b585fca0d4ddb86df9f74d3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-13 18:34:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia481330b9a889b113b585fca0d4ddb86df9f74d3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia481330b9a889b113b585fca0d4ddb86df9f74d3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
policy docs: Add volume summary under GET_ALL_POLICY entry

Using a codesearch [0] it is apparent that volume summary
enforces GET_ALL_POLICY [1]. Thus, this patchset includes
the entry for /volumes/summary under the GET_ALL_POLICY
documentation to signal to services and users all the APIs that
enforce that policy.

[0] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=vol_policy.GET_ALL_POLICY&i=nope&files=&repos=cinder
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/4b96310411540a080bb0fc32b9694ec78b05b4b6/cinder/volume/api.py#L633

Change-Id: Ic33f763df603f1170b8cf1bfc35cc285d5ed0669

commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the plan_management workbook

Update the plan_management workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

This is a continuation of I9755eaa6621ec1d83fe98e20445a4f13b4ea0686.
Some old-style messaging was added after the refactor and some redundant
lines were not removed.

Change-Id: Ia50e4055e24d07cb39d4c05745bd6694e94621f9
Related-Bug: #1757372

commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the package_update workbook

Update the package_update workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

Change-Id: Icad2846b43dec8032d9692daea390bffa7486dac
Related-Bug: #1757372

commit_message:
Add QDR profile for metrics purposes.

This patch adds a profile class to enable deploying edge routers
for metrics collection purpose.

Change-Id: I68f39b6bda02ba3920f2ab1cf2df0bd54ad7453f

commit_message:
Fix designate-api hiera references

These were looking for the wrong names so they were always taking
the default.  This broke designate in network-isolation scenarios.

Change-Id: I8cd71520bbd27b83e9a64ee3ecd1ca25bd0ed498

'}, {'created': '2018-06-18 16:47:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add fluentbit sidecars to ceph mon and ceph osd charts

This adds fluentbit sidecar containers to the ceph mon and ceph
osd charts, allowing for the gathering of ceph logs that arent
sent to stdout and stderr. This sidecar container mounts a shared
directory on /var/log/ceph, and fluentbit is configured to tail
the log files in this directory and tag the event messages
appropriately before forwarding them to fluentd. This behavior can
be toggled on or off via values, and its proposed to be disabled
by default

Change-Id: Ia2c944a68f9e7d831ac0fe11ed09468d0dc9ce71

commit_message:
Add fluentbit sidecars to ceph mon and ceph osd charts

This adds fluentbit sidecar containers to the ceph mon and ceph
osd charts, allowing for the gathering of ceph logs that arent
sent to stdout and stderr. This sidecar container mounts a shared
directory on /var/log/ceph, and fluentbit is configured to tail
the log files in this directory and tag the event messages
appropriately before forwarding them to fluentd. This behavior can
be toggled on or off via values, and its proposed to be disabled
by default

Change-Id: Ia2c944a68f9e7d831ac0fe11ed09468d0dc9ce71

commit_message:
Adds check and resyncs ODL/OVS OF pipeline

Some flows may be missing in OVS (on a per table basis) when deploying
with OpenDaylight. There is no OpenDaylight fix yet for this issue, so
this patch implements a workaround. The workaround is to check if all
the tables exist on each OVS node. If they are missing, then reset the
OpenFlow connection to the ODL controller, which will result in ODL
pushing the flows again and inserting the missing flows.

Closes-Bug: 1775436

Change-Id: I28d13a26198268cfd1f3e9e64236605f24319a04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 199ddad31bed4ea81413d0b8e940d35a71256f7c)

commit_message:
Storwize: add data reduction pool support

Data reduction pool is a new style pool on Storwize/SVC storage.
Thin provisioned/compressed vdisk copies created in a data_reduction
pool are quite different from regular pool.

This patch adds thin-provision and compressed volumes support on
data reduction pool.

Change-Id: Icb09cbacc3cfe63017d17847799c0904e06cf8a7
Implements: blueprint svc-drpool-support

commit_message:
Add /var/log/secure

This patch seeks to add /var/log/secure and therefore allow
easier audit of sudo calls which are logged to the aforementioned
file.

Change-Id: Ib1201c9acd1954375d0624539020fbce9b71a51d

commit_message:
Add tests to verify behavior on '' in self link

placement is adding a self link of '' to satisfy version discovery. Put
in a test to verify that we work properly with this. While we're in
there, add a quick test to show microversion discovery too.

Change-Id: I28e1b0ce6d372fc1e5aef335597b6db6e3b49660

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 20:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Allow running unit tests on macOS

Two issues prevented running our unit tests on macOS. Mocking
os.stat appears to cause issues internally when running tests,
and trying to load the Linux-only rtslib_fb package would
prevent even loading the source to find tests.

This mocks out packages to allow the code to be loaded and
skips tests that have issues on macOS to at least allow the
other tests to be run.

Change-Id: I1d2cfd0d68796e1af5344b481e610c2070e41093
'}]
commit_message:
Allow running unit tests on macOS

Two issues prevented running our unit tests on macOS. Mocking
os.stat appears to cause issues internally when running tests,
and trying to load the Linux-only rtslib_fb package would
prevent even loading the source to find tests.

This mocks out packages to allow the code to be loaded and
skips tests that have issues on macOS to at least allow the
other tests to be run.

Change-Id: I1d2cfd0d68796e1af5344b481e610c2070e41093

commit_message:
Fix test_volume_upload BadRequest error

This patchset fixes test_volume_upload raising a BadRequest
due to visibility being passed to upload_volume which is
unexpected [0]. That is because this param is only
available for microversion 3.1+ [1].

The issue is fixed by moving the test into the 3.1 microversion
test class: VolumesActionsV310RbacTest.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/83/571383/2/check/patrole-multinode-admin/ccceab5/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-31_15_38_44_698855
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/7d95fb79c42bdeeb82900b41acc70dead8a2ee6f/cinder/api/schemas/volume_actions.py#L150

Change-Id: Ic92504cb0442e47eea3c0e5345498ecb49ffe44f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 09:28:50.000000000', 'message': "apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
have this limitation.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock

Change-Id: Ifd7ec428442da08d9aa85718b7b8553ca75c1b5c
(cherry picked from commit f039a52f8f6d80f92b0a3c994cc36e5a1c82a87e)
"}]
commit_message:
apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
have this limitation.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock

Change-Id: Ifd7ec428442da08d9aa85718b7b8553ca75c1b5c
(cherry picked from commit f039a52f8f6d80f92b0a3c994cc36e5a1c82a87e)

commit_message:
Add policy for limit model protection

We plan to expose the enforcement model a deployment is using via
the limit API. This commit prepares for that implementation by
introducing the policy for it.

Change-Id: I03c9cec3646ee354ebcdd4ddc1168e00d611171b
Related-Bug: 1765193

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 06:15:28.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755
(cherry picked from commit e0e8a1ea68bcc33d1a07361102eb87d0cfdd94a9)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755
(cherry picked from commit e0e8a1ea68bcc33d1a07361102eb87d0cfdd94a9)

Thought about the problem of having a real stack trace in the sample file that likely change in any unrealted code modification that changes line numbers. My suggestions are the following:
* Store a traceback example in the sample file for documentation purposes. (It is basically OK to store what would made the test pass today.)
* In the functional tests that checks the sample file use notification_sample_base.NotificationSampleTestBase.ANY as a replacement for the traceback to avoid failing due to changed line numbers in the future
* Manually assert that the traceback field in the emitted exception payload is due to the exception we assume. I suggest a simple substring match for this purpose.

cheers
gibi'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-11 15:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Add full traceback to ExceptionPayload in versioned notifications

This patch adds full traceback to ExceptionPayload in versioned
notifications.

The instance fault field and instance-action REST API has already
provide the traceback to the admin users (controlable through policy)
and the notifications are also admin only things as they are emitted
to the message bus by default. So it is assumed that security is not
a bigger concern for the notification than for the REST API.

On the ML [1] post there was no objection to add new string field to the
ExceptionPayload that will hold the serialized traceback object.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128105.html

Implements: blueprint add-full-traceback-to-error-notifications

Change-Id: Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28

[{'created': '2018-06-04 08:54:16.000000000', 'message': 'Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

In case of HA routers IPv6 forwarding is not disabled by default and
then enabled only on master node.
Before this patch it was done in opposite way, so forwarding was
enabled by default and then disabled on backup nodes.
When forwarding was enabled/disabled for qg- port, MLDv2 packets are
sent and that might lead to temportary packets loss as packets to
FIP were sent to this backup node instead of master one.

Related-Bug: #1771841

commit_message:
Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

In case of HA routers IPv6 forwarding is not disabled by default and
then enabled only on master node.
Before this patch it was done in opposite way, so forwarding was
enabled by default and then disabled on backup nodes.
When forwarding was enabled/disabled for qg- port, MLDv2 packets are
sent and that might lead to temportary packets loss as packets to
FIP were sent to this backup node instead of master one.

Related-Bug: #1771841

Change-Id: Ia6b772e91c1f94612ca29d7082eca999372e60d6
(cherry picked from commit 3e9e2a5b4b2654864bb0e2a7d9b841eb03240147)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 08:12:16.000000000', 'message': '[Fullstack] Wait for SG to be applied by L2 agent

In fullstack test_securitygroup there were used simple
net_helpers.assert_ping() and assert_not_ping() functions
which tries to ping IP address 3 times with some short timeout
and test fails if result of ping will not be as expected.

Unfortunately sometimes in fullstack tests it might be not enough
if test is creating new SG or SG rule or apply SG to port and
just after that checks connection because L2 agent don't have
enough time to apply all rules on "host".
This patch changes it to use block_until_ping() and
block_until_no_ping() methods from FakeMachine fixture.
It will also check if ping is possible/not possible but
will try to check it for 1 minute before fails.

Similar change is also done for methods which checks TCP
connectivity using netcat helper class. It now uses
common_utils.wait_until_true() helper function instead of
fail immediatelly.

Change-Id: I9e523d803e3c49d5d090ae5b9d36d43ce7311535
Closes-Bug: #1774006
Closes-Bug: #1767829
(cherry picked from commit 11b41d73b48d46b7725bb97d4b85158d8bc2acfb)
'}, {'created': '2018-06-19 07:11:54.000000000', 'message': '[Fullstack] Wait for SG to be applied by L2 agent

In fullstack test_securitygroup there were used simple
net_helpers.assert_ping() and assert_not_ping() functions
which tries to ping IP address 3 times with some short timeout
and test fails if result of ping will not be as expected.

Unfortunately sometimes in fullstack tests it might be not enough
if test is creating new SG or SG rule or apply SG to port and
just after that checks connection because L2 agent don't have
enough time to apply all rules on "host".
This patch changes it to use block_until_ping() and
block_until_no_ping() methods from FakeMachine fixture.
It will also check if ping is possible/not possible but
will try to check it for 1 minute before fails.

Similar change is also done for methods which checks TCP
connectivity using netcat helper class. It now uses
common_utils.wait_until_true() helper function instead of
fail immediatelly.

Change-Id: I9e523d803e3c49d5d090ae5b9d36d43ce7311535
Closes-Bug: #1774006
Closes-Bug: #1767829
(cherry picked from commit 11b41d73b48d46b7725bb97d4b85158d8bc2acfb)
'}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Wait for SG to be applied by L2 agent

In fullstack test_securitygroup there were used simple
net_helpers.assert_ping() and assert_not_ping() functions
which tries to ping IP address 3 times with some short timeout
and test fails if result of ping will not be as expected.

Unfortunately sometimes in fullstack tests it might be not enough
if test is creating new SG or SG rule or apply SG to port and
just after that checks connection because L2 agent don't have
enough time to apply all rules on "host".
This patch changes it to use block_until_ping() and
block_until_no_ping() methods from FakeMachine fixture.
It will also check if ping is possible/not possible but
will try to check it for 1 minute before fails.

Similar change is also done for methods which checks TCP
connectivity using netcat helper class. It now uses
common_utils.wait_until_true() helper function instead of
fail immediatelly.

Change-Id: I9e523d803e3c49d5d090ae5b9d36d43ce7311535
Closes-Bug: #1774006
Closes-Bug: #1767829
(cherry picked from commit 11b41d73b48d46b7725bb97d4b85158d8bc2acfb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-15 15:09:13.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Add mac-table-size to be set on each ovs bridge

By default number of MAC addresses which ovs stores in memory
is quite low - 2048.

Any eviction of a MAC learning table entry triggers revalidation.
Such revalidation is very costly so it cause high CPU usage by
ovs-vswitchd process.

To workaround this problem, higher value of mac-table-size
option can be set for bridge. Then this revalidation will happen
less often and CPU usage will be lower.
This patch adds config option for neutron-openvswitch-agent to allow
users tune this setting in bridges managed by agent.
By default this value is set to 50000 which should be enough for most
systems.

Change-Id: If628f52d75c2b5fec87ad61e0219b3286423468c
Closes-Bug: #1775797
(cherry picked from commit 1f8378e0ac4b8c3fc4670144e6efc51940d796ad)

commit_message:
[OVS] Add mac-table-size to be set on each ovs bridge

By default number of MAC addresses which ovs stores in memory
is quite low - 2048.

Any eviction of a MAC learning table entry triggers revalidation.
Such revalidation is very costly so it cause high CPU usage by
ovs-vswitchd process.

To workaround this problem, higher value of mac-table-size
option can be set for bridge. Then this revalidation will happen
less often and CPU usage will be lower.
This patch adds config option for neutron-openvswitch-agent to allow
users tune this setting in bridges managed by agent.
By default this value is set to 50000 which should be enough for most
systems.

Change-Id: If628f52d75c2b5fec87ad61e0219b3286423468c
Closes-Bug: #1775797
(cherry picked from commit 1f8378e0ac4b8c3fc4670144e6efc51940d796ad)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 21:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for handling multiple error codes

Patrole currently cannot handle the scenario where two possible
error codes can returned by Neutron policy enforcement for a
failed policy check (403 Forbidden and 404 NotFound), depending
on what role is being tested. Patrole framework can only handle
one expected_exception.

This change introduces the ability to override the error code
expected for any Patrole test case, for any service being tested.
The tester would have to populate a JSON file with the overrides
on a per-service, per-role, per-action(rule) basis. Then provide
the path to the file within the [patrole] section of the
tempest.conf file.

Change-Id: I5cd861e184da90bb27f8ba454c94fa4d4f99c269
Closes-Bug: #1772710

This change introduces the ability to override the error code
expected for any Patrole test case, for any service being tested.
The tester would have to populate the custome requirements file
(after all of the action/roles allowed mapping) with the expected
error codes on a per-service, per-role, per-action(rule) basis.

'}, {'created': '2018-06-12 20:46:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for handling multiple error codes

Patrole currently cannot handle the scenario where two possible
error codes can returned by Neutron policy enforcement for a
failed policy check (403 Forbidden and 404 NotFound), depending
on what role is being tested. Patrole framework can only handle
one expected_exception.

This change builds upon the recent multi-policy support to allow
the tester to specify multiple policy actions for one API test.
Each test that uses multiple policy actions can add a
"expected_error_code_all_fail" parameter to indicate what error
code to expect if all of the rules in the rule list fail the
policy check.

This handles the cases in Neutron where Neutron may use a second
policy rule to determine whether or not to return a 403 error
code or a 404 error code. The tester is expected to list out
which policy rules are being tested by the API endpoint test.

Change-Id: I5cd861e184da90bb27f8ba454c94fa4d4f99c269
Closes-Bug: #1772710
'}, {'created': '2018-06-12 20:49:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for handling multiple error codes

policy check.

This handles the cases in Neutron where Neutron may use a second
policy rule to determine whether or not to return a 403 error
code or a 404 error code. The tester is expected to list out
which policy rules are being tested by the API endpoint test.

Change-Id: I5cd861e184da90bb27f8ba454c94fa4d4f99c269
Closes-Bug: #1772710
'}, {'created': '2018-06-13 18:20:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for handling multiple error codes

Patrole currently cannot handle the scenario where two possible
error codes can returned by Neutron policy enforcement for a
failed policy check (403 Forbidden and 404 NotFound), depending
on what role is being tested. Patrole framework can only handle
one expected_exception.

This change builds upon the recent multi-policy support to allow
the tester to specify multiple policy actions for one API test.
For each policy action, the tester would need to specify an
error code that is expected if the action should fail. If multiple
policy actions fail, the error code for the first policy action
that fails will be expected to be returned from the service.

This handles the cases in Neutron where Neutron may use a second
policy rule to determine whether or not to return a 403 error
code or a 404 error code. The tester is expected to list out
which policy rules are being tested by the API endpoint test.

Change-Id: I5cd861e184da90bb27f8ba454c94fa4d4f99c269
Closes-Bug: #1772710

'}, {'created': '2018-06-15 19:58:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for handling multiple error codes

Patrole currently cannot handle the scenario where two possible
error codes can returned by Neutron policy enforcement for a
failed policy check (403 Forbidden and 404 NotFound), depending
on what role is being tested. Patrole framework can only handle
one expected_exception.

This change builds upon the recent multi-policy support to allow
the tester to specify multiple policy actions for one API test.
For each policy action, the tester would need to specify an
error code that is expected if the action should fail. If multiple
policy actions fail, the error code for the first policy action
that fails will be expected to be returned from the service.

This handles the cases in Neutron where Neutron may use a second
policy rule to determine whether or not to return a 403 error
code or a 404 error code. The tester is expected to list out
which policy rules are being tested by the API endpoint test.

Change-Id: I5cd861e184da90bb27f8ba454c94fa4d4f99c269
Closes-Bug: #1772710

commit_message:
Add support for handling multiple error codes

Patrole currently cannot handle the scenario where two possible
error codes can returned by Neutron policy enforcement for a
failed policy check (403 Forbidden and 404 NotFound), depending
on what role is being tested. Patrole framework can only handle
one expected_exception.

This change builds upon the recent multi-policy support to allow
the tester to specify multiple policy actions for one API test.
For each policy action, the tester would need to specify an
error code that is expected if the action should fail. If multiple
policy actions fail, the error code for the first policy action
that fails will be expected to be returned from the service.

This handles the cases in Neutron where Neutron may use a second
policy rule to determine whether or not to return a 403 error
code or a 404 error code. The tester is expected to list out
which policy rules are being tested by the API endpoint test.

Change-Id: I5cd861e184da90bb27f8ba454c94fa4d4f99c269
Closes-Bug: #1772710

(3 comments)

I like the way you've solved this - by making sure we always send the root provider IDs to _get_usages..., since we already have those available, rather than "fixing" the db query.  But at this point we've altered the semantics enough that some minor rework is necessary.

In summary, the _get_usages_by_provider method:

- Should now be named _get_usages_by_provider_tree
- Should be documented as accepting root RP IDs, since that's all it needs
- Should be invoked with only root RP IDs, since that's all it needs.

I'm also not seeing the need to split the two patches.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-08 17:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

(1 comment)

A soft +1, soft because I'm mostly relying on the strength of the now passing tests rather than a full comprehension of the changes. I'm close, but not all the way.

In some future timeline where we've got a bit of time, I would be interesting to run some of the tests with SQL logging turned on and do some human analysis on the multiple statements and see what we can refactor in the raw SQL and then port those changes into the python. 

Near http://p.anticdent.org/JeT Jay talks about some of the goals he's had with how we manage complex queries. What we've got right now is neither "only go complicated when we have to" (which is an incomplete paraphrase of what jay is saying in IRC) nor one of the things we bounced around in the very early days of placement (mid 2016): a mystical SQL statement that did much of everything.

Despite my desire for us to get the python factored into much smaller chunks (as much as possible), long-term, if we're making a commitment to an RDBMS as our datastore, if we can push as much complexity in there and blackbox a lot of it, that would be great.

But that's all long-term. For now, we're moving in the right direction and learning stuff.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-11 22:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Nice.'}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2018-06-12 02:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-12 04:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

We really can't throw away the WHERE condition on that derived usages table, since that will trigger a full table scan across the biggest table in the DB (allocations) every time we run this.

Please see inline for how to keep the WHERE condition against the derived table but adapted for the resource_providers.root_provider_id constraints instead of the resource_providers.id constraint."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-14 14:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-14 15:57:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27: Code-Review-1

Okay, I just looked through the next patch (the one that adds a microversion) and am disturbed by the fact that it only includes code to *revert* to the previous behavior.  Which means somewhere along the way, we enabled the new behavior without a microversion.  Hopefully that's here, and we can squash these two patches together so we don't actually cut over behavior until the microversion lands.

I'm still checking on this, but downvoting to hold out until I'm sure one way or the other."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-14 16:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

Okay, yeah, I copied the gabbi fixture changes and the "get allocation candidates with nested provider" gabbi test from the following patch, only changing the microversion to 1.27, and it passed.

Unfortunately, it also passes on master except for the provider_summaries count.  So this ship has sailed :('}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-15 05:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-15 05:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/559480/28/ : SUCCESS in 3h 57m 39s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-15 23:23:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

Tetsuro, the conclusion we eventually reached was that we just need to make sure microversions <1.28 (or whatever this winds up being) behave the same way in Rocky as they did in Queens.  What that means is that we should write some test cases that run GET /a-c at earlier microversions against a tree like the one you've introduced in the following patch.  If we compose the tests against a Queens base, we should expect it to return results with at most one non-sharing provider (anywhere in the tree).  If we then run that test against Rocky as it currently stands, it will fail; so we would need to do the thing where we swizzle the test results to be wrong (so they pass), with the right ones commented out.  And then, before we cut Rocky, do whatever it takes to make them come out right again.  Which may in fact be what you've done in the next patch - but having these tests in place will let us confirm it.  So I'm not going to downvote this patch anymore because of this, but one of us needs to write up the test case(s) in a separate patch.

I still need to re-review this patch, but I'll wait until the merge conflict is resolved."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-16 08:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-16 09:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

involved.

appeared in the provider_summaries.

commit_message:
Return all nested providers in tree

Getting allocation candidates, in provider_summaries we have only
providers that are in allocation_requests.

This patch fixes it to include all the providers in trees in play.

Change-Id: I108dceb13bdefc541b272ea953acc1dec2945647
Blueprint: placement-return-all-resources

commit_message:
Add minimum version for requirements

OpenStack requirements now checks the minimum
verion for each requirements library[1].

This patch added the missing one to let the CI happy.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574367

Change-Id: I0deaa8f2b3248955d5a7baa7b2cb531516343ffe

commit_message:
Passwordless sudo Documentation

The information to setup passwordless sudo is only present for
multinode deployment. This patch moves all common requirements to
a 'Common Requirements' location before any of the deployment
instructions.

Change-Id: I22b14dec2153dabd57b451e0a8f7d30d423760b0

commit_message:
Revert "Update the cirros version to "0.4.0""

We are reverting to 0.3.5 in order to use the upstream image
cache, also, devstack tests with 0.3.5 so it would be good to
stay consistent.

We can go back to 0.4.0 once devstack uses it and this will
avoid us having to pull down the image with every job.

This reverts commit 2167e5fe6ee345865a74b05cc7e256a201a08455.

Change-Id: I607cdf0916206bfc11f4e1b4d54ab663e654adb0

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Update the cirros version to "0.4.0""

We are reverting to 0.3.5 in order to use the upstream image
cache, also, devstack tests with 0.3.5 so it would be good to
stay consistent.

We can go back to 0.4.0 once devstack uses it and this will
avoid us having to pull down the image with every job.

This reverts commit df5b0067d69de3c55816847c259cd78012b30a38.

Change-Id: I1f0fd17614194a775a4614865687ecdad17a128a

commit_message:
Use the infrastructure provided reverse cache for Percona

We see a lot of timeouts with the Percona repositories so hopefully
with this patch we will be hitting the reverse proxy cache which means
less trips to the internet and less gate failures!

Depends-On: I19be46fc3ac7e8938178d9d8cb4d1dfeadc6f00b
Depends-On: I4d9d408f99608f1625dac9e0802e8d8d77b0f48b

add champion section to goal template

mention that.

commit_message:
Add required_platform@openstack validator

With Rally > 0.12 we need to handle checks for admin/users credentials
manually.

Depends-On: I546bbd9b0e35abb30195b0f8c98756a9cce10107

commit_message:
Implement privsep boilerplate in cinder.

This includes implementing a first trivial example of how to use
privsep to run something as root, specifically the cgroup throttling
driver.

This code is modelled strongly on how nova has chosen to use privsep.
Consistency is probably good here, but it does imply that the cinder
team is ok with the decisons nova has made about implementation.

Change-Id: Ic401138a10a72cb4b976a1a6aba272cafcb40d8b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 17:08:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8 new warnings and pip install error

This patch is a squash of two fix that are needed together to have a
successful zuul run.

1. pep8 fix (cherry-picked from master:
   87eb1b15be8a4e39f3344f829d1a5b295a37a858 )

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer
relevant (test_firewall) were deleted.

Conflicts:
	neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py

2. Avoid parameterless pip install

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all stable branches due to the
new pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case
of calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

This patch also disables E402 hacking check because releasenotes/* violates it
(the issue is not present in Queens+ where
Ib19f7ea4ea136180f38bc78389f51b6b5d179ab8 is merged).

Conflicts:
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/queens/expand/876782258a43_create_default_firewall_groups_table.py
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/queens/expand/f24e0d5e5bff_uniq_firewallgroupportassociation0port.py
      neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin_v2.py

Change-Id: If893cf2bc136d09e09344a81fd996ac89479a135
(cherry picked from commit 58a62382e939b47d7bb75e985852aa214f9f3cdd)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 new warnings and pip install error

This patch is a squash of two fix that are needed together to have a
successful zuul run.

1. pep8 fix (cherry-picked from master:
   87eb1b15be8a4e39f3344f829d1a5b295a37a858 )

A recent change in pep/pycodingchecks introduced new warnings as part of
the pep8 target that causes pep8 to fail now.

This patch fixes code that issued warnings W503,E731,E266,E402

In addition, old tests which were not ran anyway, and are no longer
relevant (test_firewall) were deleted.

Conflicts:
	neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py

2. Avoid parameterless pip install

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all stable branches due to the
new pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case
of calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

This patch also disables E402 hacking check because releasenotes/* violates it
(the issue is not present in Queens+ where
Ib19f7ea4ea136180f38bc78389f51b6b5d179ab8 is merged).

Conflicts:
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/queens/expand/876782258a43_create_default_firewall_groups_table.py
      neutron_fwaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/queens/expand/f24e0d5e5bff_uniq_firewallgroupportassociation0port.py
      neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin_v2.py

Change-Id: If893cf2bc136d09e09344a81fd996ac89479a135
(cherry picked from commit 58a62382e939b47d7bb75e985852aa214f9f3cdd)

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: Ic910eed43c3b56dadbdcf120f2f6f9c491ab7bc7

commit_message:
Add splitstack detection to auxilary-facts

The upgrade prepare/converge templates are used for ffu as well. This
change runs the steps for detecting if a splitstack env is in use
in the auxiliary-facts so the splitstack_deployment var is made
available for ffu as well.

Change-Id: I49a34e323cf9479ef387e20b7f831d574a724cd8
(cherry picked from commit 91f7034f66db7596079b80c0e8d8bca35695710e)

commit_message:
Switch VEXXHOST to 'v3password' auth_type

All of our infrastructure has been moved to Queens except for
Keystone which should be happening in the next few days, therefore
we no longer have v2.0 APIs.

Change-Id: I5ccfc0e26aaf4eff4eaefbbec636efb50e137efa

This changes the default image for kube-state-metrics to use the

commit_message:
Kube-State-Metrics: Change default image used

This changes the default image for kube-state-metrics to use the
bitnami image instead of the coreos image. This allows us to
override the image entrypoint, as the Alpine based image used
previously did not easily allow us to do so. Adding this also
makes creating a common prometheus exporter deployment template
easier, as it reduces the functional differences between exporter
charts and templates

Change-Id: I6c4aac36f563fcb15f52640bc6f9913b45b4358a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 20:28:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MigrateData object tests for compat routines

Several of the tests for obj_make_compatible() in the test_migrate_data
module were making negative contains assertions (which are a bit
dangerous when unchecked) against the wrong level of the primitive.
This fixes those, adds at least one positive assertion to validate the
pattern in each case.

Change-Id: If94428b7ac47e61875e3e3efaf681ed6500b3fea
'}]
commit_message:
Fix MigrateData object tests for compat routines

Several of the tests for obj_make_compatible() in the test_migrate_data
module were making negative contains assertions (which are a bit
dangerous when unchecked) against the wrong level of the primitive.
This fixes those, adds at least one positive assertion to validate the
pattern in each case.

Change-Id: If94428b7ac47e61875e3e3efaf681ed6500b3fea

commit_message:
Remove usage of deprecated rabbit params

rabbit param removed from puppet-neutron in [1],
Required transport_url is taken care by puppet-stack-config.yaml.
This patch removes the usage of removed rabbit_hosts param.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570307/

Closes-Bug: #1777616
Change-Id: I9d561aa2e2f71b8892580950e9664d62f956773d

subject: Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues
messages: [{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-09 15:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2018-05-11 07:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-06-19 16:44:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 11:42:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: I55879d70f05de60a423176e5bf1803758f27c691
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: I55879d70f05de60a423176e5bf1803758f27c691

set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6e73db41d64343dc76ef33bed4638c93b131bd88
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6e73db41d64343dc76ef33bed4638c93b131bd88

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
messages: [{'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-06-09 14:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-19 16:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 14:40:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7cb1b1dba2157338831f6b1ea76e90e83580045c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7cb1b1dba2157338831f6b1ea76e90e83580045c

commit_message:
Bump packethost nodes to 95

We have quota for 100 nodes, but we share with the control plane, so
subtract some for the slightly oversized mirror server and give some
headroom for a manual node launch if need be.

Change-Id: I5c494c6d6c22ac4392280e6ec11ec7eb133f6f0e

commit_message:
nodepool grafana : remove job runtimes

These stats aren't updating any more.  Unfortunately, I don't think
there's any current replacement as nodepool doesn't have any insight
into the job it is satisfying a request for.

Change-Id: Ib69fbda5ee019180cd8761d0ead474b426bce379

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-06-14 17:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Sure, Eric. I am in the SF Bay Area. Shall we discuss in #openstack-nova channel? I am available till 2 PM PST today. Tomorrow, 3:30 PM or later works better.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-15 13:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Pursuant to our conversation with Dan in IRC yesterday [1] I drew up a flow diagram for the spawn use case [2].  Please have a look and find me in IRC when you want to discuss (or comment on the review itself [3]).

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-06-14.log.html#t2018-06-14T18:38:28
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/45/575545/1/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/77f4d6a/html/specs/rocky/approved/nova-cyborg-flow.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575545/1/specs/rocky/approved/nova-cyborg-flow.rst'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-06-17 16:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Eric, Cyborg can discover devices and their resources automatically, so there is no need for the user to run a CLI to create an attachment UUID. Please see this etherpad and sequence diag:
    https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/os-acc-discussion 
 https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1gbfimiyA1f5sTeobN9mpavEkHT7Z_ScNUqimOkdIYGA/edit'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-18 23:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Sundar-

Okay, I think the disconnect was: if the specification of the accelerator comes from the flavor, we don't need to precreate the "VAN" object prior to spawn.  It looks like Dan is anticipating a need to specify more details (which maybe *unique* to a *specific* accelerator instance) that aren't appropriate to include in a flavor.  But perhaps as a first pass, this will be fine.

What we still agree on, though, is having os-acc house these "VAN" thingies, which point to stevedore-able `plugin` classes with plug/unplug methods - and that's a delta from what was in this spec, yah?

(Dan also still sees the need for the `bind` step - we may need to discuss that further.)'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-06-19 03:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> What we still agree on, though, is having os-acc house these "VAN"
 > thingies, which point to stevedore-able `plugin` classes with
 > plug/unplug methods - and that's a delta from what was in this
 > spec, yah?
 
Yes, the notion of a plugin can be added to this spec. Also, specifics of how to implement VANs are not in this spec, but are written in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/os-acc-discussion. I can add that here after you review it.

 > (Dan also still sees the need for the `bind` step - we may need to
 > discuss that further.)
The getVAN() in https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1gbfimiyA1f5sTeobN9mpavEkHT7Z_ScNUqimOkdIYGA/edit is the equivalent of the bind step, IIUC.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:49:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sundar, the etherpad and diagram look good to me - at least close enough to put together a spec amendment patch where we can refine the details.

What's the status of the cyborg-specs repo?  If we're going to start putting seqdiags into specs, it would be nice for the framework/requirements for that to live in cyborg-specs rather than here."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2018-06-19 16:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks, Eric. Yes, the sequence diagram should live here. I will update the spec.'}]

commit_message:
Specification for Cyborg/Nova/Glance interaction in the
compute node, including os-acc library API.

Updated to note that a flavor may refer to a function
by name, for operators' ease of use.

Change-Id: Iefdfbdeadd5894f8d6e45368433ae951105f5a7e
Proposes: spec cyborg compute node API

[{'created': '2018-06-18 23:40:08.000000000', 'message': "Change 'Member' role reference to 'member'

Keystone has changed the default role during bootstrap from 'Member'
to 'member' therefore the tests which operated under the assumption
of having the 'Member' role assigned are no longer passing.

This patch addresses this issue, however, long term, it's probably
better to create a role and assign it during the test rather than
assuming one already exists, but that's probably for another patch.

Change-Id: I84f0a1004e45d72c72802b38eeeba2d2c259c483
"}]
commit_message:
Change 'Member' role reference to 'member'

Keystone has changed the default role during bootstrap from 'Member'
to 'member' therefore the tests which operated under the assumption
of having the 'Member' role assigned are no longer passing.

This patch addresses this issue, however, long term, it's probably
better to create a role and assign it during the test rather than
assuming one already exists, but that's probably for another patch.

Change-Id: I84f0a1004e45d72c72802b38eeeba2d2c259c483

commit_message:
Keystone: use internal interface by default

This PS updates the openrc functions to use the internal interface by
default for keystone actions performed within the cluster.

Change-Id: I491618d9fd473917e2034a315f292db746f0d7cc
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: Handle role creation as they are case insensitive
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 16137, 'name': 'Tobias Urdin', 'email': 'tobias.urdin@binero.com', 'username': 'tobasco'}, {'_account_id': 16312, 'name': 'Alfredo Moralejo', 'email': 'amoralej@redhat.com', 'username': 'amoralej'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-06-19 07:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-06-19 07:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2018-06-19 08:08:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

This fixes case insensitiviness in creating a role, but there are other places to fix, specially keystone_user_role. Currently, idempotency is broken because of roles being case insensitive.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-06-19 09:38:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This fixes case insensitiviness in creating a role, but there are
 > other places to fix, specially keystone_user_role. Currently,
 > idempotency is broken because of roles being case insensitive.

@amoralej it's different in case of keystone_user_role, i check adding same role(openstack role add x|X --user y --project z) multiple times to same user works fine.
If it's an issue we can consider fixing that in seperate patch."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-19 09:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2018-06-19 10:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > This fixes case insensitiviness in creating a role, but there are
 > > other places to fix, specially keystone_user_role. Currently,
 > > idempotency is broken because of roles being case insensitive.
 > 
 > @amoralej it's different in case of keystone_user_role, i check
 > adding same role(openstack role add x|X --user y --project z)
 > multiple times to same user works fine.
 > If it's an issue we can consider fixing that in seperate patch.

@ykarel, currently keystone_user_role is broken because of case insensitiviness. reproducer:

1. Create "member" role

2. Create following manifest:

keystone_user_role{'glance@openstack':
    roles => ['Member'],
    ensure => present,
}

Applies multiple times the manifest:

1st time

# puppet apply test.pp 
Notice: Compiled catalog for test4.rdocloud in environment production in 0.23 seconds
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Keystone_user_role[glance@openstack]/ensure: created
Notice: Applied catalog in 16.50 seconds

user is added to member role as expected - ok

2nd time

# puppet apply test.pp 
Notice: Compiled catalog for test4.rdocloud in environment production in 0.24 seconds
Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Keystone_user_role[glance@openstack]/roles: roles changed ['member'] to 'Member'
Notice: Applied catalog in 20.39 seconds

User glance is REMOVED from the role (actually, it's first added to "Member" and then removed from "member", what efectively is removing the user from the role)

If you prefer to do separated patch for this, it's ok, but it's something to be fixed.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-06-19 10:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > (1 comment)
 > > >
 > > > This fixes case insensitiviness in creating a role, but there
 > are
 > > > other places to fix, specially keystone_user_role. Currently,
 > > > idempotency is broken because of roles being case insensitive.
 > >
 > > @amoralej it's different in case of keystone_user_role, i check
 > > adding same role(openstack role add x|X --user y --project z)
 > > multiple times to same user works fine.
 > > If it's an issue we can consider fixing that in seperate patch.
 > 
 > @ykarel, currently keystone_user_role is broken because of case
 > insensitiviness. reproducer:
 > 
 > 1. Create "member" role
 > 
 > 2. Create following manifest:
 > 
 > keystone_user_role{'glance@openstack':
 > roles => ['Member'],
 > ensure => present,
 > }
 > 
 > Applies multiple times the manifest:
 > 
 > 1st time
 > 
 > # puppet apply test.pp
 > Notice: Compiled catalog for test4.rdocloud in environment
 > production in 0.23 seconds
 > Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Keystone_user_role[glance@openstack]/ensure:
 > created
 > Notice: Applied catalog in 16.50 seconds
 > 
 > user is added to member role as expected - ok
 > 
 > 2nd time
 > 
 > # puppet apply test.pp
 > Notice: Compiled catalog for test4.rdocloud in environment
 > production in 0.24 seconds
 > Notice: /Stage[main]/Main/Keystone_user_role[glance@openstack]/roles:
 > roles changed ['member'] to 'Member'
 > Notice: Applied catalog in 20.39 seconds
 > 
 > User glance is REMOVED from the role (actually, it's first added to
 > "Member" and then removed from "member", what efectively is
 > removing the user from the role)
 > 
 > If you prefer to do separated patch for this, it's ok, but it's
 > something to be fixed.

@amoralej, but from keystone context, both 'member' and 'Member' are same, so internally role should not be removed from user. yes it's issue from puppet side which is not handling case insensivity and reporting it false, which really is a issue and needs a fix. I will take care that in seperate patch.'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2018-06-19 12:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-19 14:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-19 14:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 07:16:12.000000000', 'message': 'Handle role creation as they are case insensitive

Keystone roles are not case sensitive, so while handling
roles we need to ignore case.

Change-Id: I0a1a0779b9609185a9208dc3204d23a5fcce255a
Closes-Bug: #1777451
'}]
commit_message:
Handle role creation as they are case insensitive

Keystone roles are not case sensitive, so while handling
roles we need to ignore case.

Change-Id: I0a1a0779b9609185a9208dc3204d23a5fcce255a
Closes-Bug: #1777451

commit_message:
DS8K: correct the return value for initialize_connection method

In patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564724/, the comparison
operation is case sensitive and DS8K driver converts the return host
wwpn value to uppercase for initialize_connection method so this caused
os_brick not to discover the volume for the host.

Change-Id: Iffc30ac75851436a1b0aed7099656d4076ff687a
Closes-Bug: 1776134

commit_message:
Add a reminder for compatibility workarounds

rally-openstack package should not be aligned to one constant version of Rally
framework. It means that some workarounds for compatibility stuff are
provided.
The new test raises an error if with bumping a minimum required version
nothing is changed, i.e. no one is removed outdated code.

Change-Id: I0eef307677ba15c037b5013d170df608dfd04017

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 17:54:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add config option to block image-backed servers with 0 root disk flavor

This adds a new config option which defaults to behave in a
backward compatible way, but will allow operators to enforce
that servers created with a zero disk flavor must also be
volume-backed servers.

Allowing users to upload their own images and create image-backed
servers on local disk with zero root disk size flavors can be
potentially hazardous if the size of the image is unexpectedly
large, since it can consume the local disk (or shared storage pool).

It should be noted that setting the new config option to True will
result in a non-backward compatible API behavior change and no
microversion is being introduced for this because enforcement via
a new microversion would not close the security gap on any previous
microversions.

Related compute API reference and user documentation is updated
to mention the config option along with a release note since
this is tied to a security bug, which will be backported to stable
branches.

Change-Id: Id67e1285a0522474844de130c9263e11868f67fb
Closes-Bug: #1739646

commit_message:
Add policy rule to block image-backed servers with 0 root disk flavor

This adds a new policy rule which defaults to behave in a
backward compatible way, but will allow operators to enforce
that servers created with a zero disk flavor must also be
volume-backed servers.

Allowing users to upload their own images and create image-backed
servers on local disk with zero root disk size flavors can be
potentially hazardous if the size of the image is unexpectedly
large, since it can consume the local disk (or shared storage pool).

It should be noted that disabling the new policy rule will
result in a non-backward compatible API behavior change and no
microversion is being introduced for this because enforcement via
a new microversion would not close the security gap on any previous
microversions.

Related compute API reference and user documentation is updated
to mention the policy rule along with a release note since
this is tied to a security bug, which will be backported to stable
branches.

Change-Id: Id67e1285a0522474844de130c9263e11868f67fb
Closes-Bug: #1739646

commit_message:
Debian: disable FWaaS

It looks like FWaaS is broken with neutron-api & neutron-rpc-server
instead of neutron-server, which means it wont work in Debian, which is
using this at the moment.

This patch therefore is only temporary. It disables the FWaaS extension
in Neutron if os_package_type is Debian.

Change-Id: I95330f46cae3d4883a1d8d877128e58cc1da8dec

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-03 21:27:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add trusted_certificates parameter

This change adds suport for a trusted_certificates parameter to the
create and rebuild commands. The parameter can be used to define a
comma-delimited list of trusted certificate IDs. If this parameter is
not used, the value of the OS_TRUSTED_CERTIFICATE_IDS environment
variable will be used instead. This value will be converted into a list
before being passed on.

Change-Id: I235541a689732826950c7b2a510d5835211120c3
Depends-On: Iedd3fea0e86648fae364f075915555dcb2c4f199
Implements: blueprint nova-validate-certificates
'}, {'created': '2017-09-04 01:25:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add trusted_certificates parameter

This change adds suport for a trusted_certificates parameter to the
create and rebuild commands. The parameter can be used to define a
comma-delimited list of trusted certificate IDs. If this parameter is
not used, the value of the OS_TRUSTED_CERTIFICATE_IDS environment
variable will be used instead. This value will be converted into a list
before being passed on.

Change-Id: I235541a689732826950c7b2a510d5835211120c3
Depends-On: Iedd3fea0e86648fae364f075915555dcb2c4f199
Implements: blueprint nova-validate-certificates

'}, {'created': '2018-06-15 13:38:47.000000000', 'message': 'Microversion 2.63 - Add trusted_image_certificates

This change adds a `--trusted-image-certificate-id` option to the
`nova boot` and `nova rebuild` commands. This option takes in a
a single trusted certificate ID. The option may be used multiple times
to specify multiple trusted certificate IDs, which will be
used to validate certificates in the image signature verification
process. If ID values are not specified using this option, the value of
the newly added OS_TRUSTED_IMAGE_CERTIFICATE_IDS environment variable
will be used instead. This value will be converted into a list before
being passed on.

The ``nova rebuild`` command also gets a new
``--trusted-image-certificates-unset`` option to unset/reset the
trusted image certificates in a server during rebuild. This is
similar to unsetting key_name and user_data during rebuild.

Corresponding `trusted_image_certificates` kwarg has been added to the
server create and rebuild Python API bindings.

Co-Authored-By: Brianna Poulos <Brianna.Poulos@jhuapl.edu>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Implements: blueprint nova-validate-certificates

`nova boot` and `nova rebuild` commands. This option takes in a
a single trusted certificate ID. The option may be used multiple times
to specify multiple trusted certificate IDs, which will be
used to validate certificates in the image signature verification
process. If ID values are not specified using this option, the value of

being passed on.

The ``nova rebuild`` command also gets a new
``--trusted-image-certificates-unset`` option to unset/reset the
trusted image certificates in a server during rebuild. This is
similar to unsetting key_name and user_data during rebuild.

Corresponding `trusted_image_certificates` kwarg has been added to the
server create and rebuild Python API bindings.

commit_message:
Microversion 2.63 - Add trusted_image_certificates

This change adds a `--trusted-image-certificate-id` option to the
`nova boot` and `nova rebuild` commands. This option takes in a
a single trusted certificate ID. The option may be used multiple times
to specify multiple trusted certificate IDs, which will be
used to validate certificates in the image signature verification
process. If ID values are not specified using this option, the value of
the newly added OS_TRUSTED_IMAGE_CERTIFICATE_IDS environment variable
will be used instead. This value will be converted into a list before
being passed on.

The ``nova rebuild`` command also gets a new
``--trusted-image-certificates-unset`` option to unset/reset the
trusted image certificates in a server during rebuild. This is
similar to unsetting key_name and user_data during rebuild.

Corresponding `trusted_image_certificates` kwarg has been added to the
server create and rebuild Python API bindings.

Co-Authored-By: Brianna Poulos <Brianna.Poulos@jhuapl.edu>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I235541a689732826950c7b2a510d5835211120c3
Implements: blueprint nova-validate-certificates
