slagle, we might need a hint from you here. Error is:

```
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502106 | ubuntu-xenial | FAIL: tripleoclient.tests.v1.overcloud_deploy.test_overcloud_deploy.TestDeployOvercloud.test_tht_deploy_with_plan_environment_file
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502126 | ubuntu-xenial | tags: worker-5
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502175 | ubuntu-xenial | ----------------------------------------------------------------------
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502204 | ubuntu-xenial | Traceback (most recent call last):
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502298 | ubuntu-xenial |   File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/.tox/py27/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mock/mock.py", line 1305, in patched
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502334 | ubuntu-xenial |     return func(*args, **keywargs)
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502395 | ubuntu-xenial | TypeError: test_tht_deploy_with_plan_environment_file() takes exactly 25 arguments (24 given)
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502419 | ubuntu-xenial | Ran 314 tests in 20.485s
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502443 | ubuntu-xenial | FAILED (id=0, failures=1)
2018-06-15 08:01:17.502478 | ubuntu-xenial | error: testr failed (1)
2018-06-15 08:01:17.538626 | ubuntu-xenial | ERROR: InvocationError for command '/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/.tox/py27/bin/python setup.py testr --slowest --testr-args=' (exited with code 1)
```

So it says that we are missing an argument, but in that specific function the number of parameters is the same as in master: https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/blob/master/tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py#L375'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-18 16:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:30:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-06-18 20:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-19 03:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-06-19 13:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-04 16:04:26.000000000', 'message': 'Convert enable-ssh-admin.sh to python

Instead of using the script from the templates, use python for the
enable-ssh-admin logic. This will allow for more properly handling
failures.

This also fixes a race condition where sshd has not already started on
some of the nodes before we try and connect via ssh. A timeout is added
where we wait for the port to come up. If the timeout has passed and the
port is still not up, then an exception is raised.

Change-Id: I3431d2ec724a880baf0de8f586490d145bedf870
Closes-Bug: #1769230

(cherry picked from commit I3431d2ec724a880baf0de8f586490d145bedf870)
'}]
commit_message:
Convert enable-ssh-admin.sh to python

Instead of using the script from the templates, use python for the
enable-ssh-admin logic. This will allow for more properly handling
failures.

This also fixes a race condition where sshd has not already started on
some of the nodes before we try and connect via ssh. A timeout is added
where we wait for the port to come up. If the timeout has passed and the
port is still not up, then an exception is raised.

Change-Id: I3431d2ec724a880baf0de8f586490d145bedf870
Closes-Bug: #1769230
(cherry picked from commit I3431d2ec724a880baf0de8f586490d145bedf870)

"}, {'created': '2018-04-27 19:37:40.000000000', 'message': "Docs: Autogenerate config documentation

commit_message:
Docs: Autogenerate config documentation

The documentation we had of Heat's config options was static and had
last been updated for the Ocata release. Ensure the documentation is
kept up to date by automatically generating it from the source when the
docs are built.

Change-Id: I06b3848451541f8f2d98748c06c556b9dc1104c6

commit_message:
Add NODEPOOL_PERCONA_PROXY to mirror_info

The way that we consume things, we need to actually have the host with
port and URL to configure the roles downstream.

Depends-On: Ic3c255bd24d1202fec436d4fcc484ce420110518
Change-Id: I19be46fc3ac7e8938178d9d8cb4d1dfeadc6f00b

commit_message:
Add unmanage_snapshot method for RBD driver

It will raise "AttributeError: 'RBDDriver' object has no attribute
'unmanage_snapshot'" when executing 'cinder snapshot-unmanage' cmd.
So implement the method in volume/drivers/rbd.py.

Change-Id: Id28f013229065c73c527f50ee2575bd6861a2d71
Closes-Bug: #1645288

The resource provider decorated with this trait indicates that

'}]
commit_message:
Adds HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING standard trait

This patch adds a new standard trait: HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING.

The resource provider decorated with this trait indicates that
the hyperthreading is enabled on the provider.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: I762a7f11bd10f93855850d09751415d35e5b38e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 08:05:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove project_id foreign key for limit

Now the limit table has a foreign key for project id. But "project"
and "limit" may use different kind of data backend, For exmaple, if
users maintain a out-tree backend for project, the fk in limit table
will lead error.

This patch dropped the fk in the limit table.

Change-Id: Ieeb249423df2cf1060a047510b94a403a2d4508e
bp: unified-limits
'}]
commit_message:
Remove project_id foreign key for limit

Now the limit table has a foreign key for project id. But "project"
and "limit" may use different kind of data backend, For exmaple, if
users maintain a out-tree backend for project, the fk in limit table
will lead error.

This patch dropped the fk in the limit table.

Change-Id: Ieeb249423df2cf1060a047510b94a403a2d4508e
bp: unified-limits

commit_message:
Allow neutron_options customization for dashboard

By default only profile_support can be configured depending of the neutron
mechanism driver used (cisco_n1kv).
This patch allows to add more neutron options to enable lbaas, vpnaas, etc...

Change-Id: I7c040519b45b60910778f93b8ffe7a413b4cb6ae
Closes-Bug: #1594388
(cherry picked from commit 16c6161d126cb8ab477da103dc6510b93f171c1e)

commit_message:
Allow neutron_options customization for dashboard

By default only profile_support can be configured depending of the neutron
mechanism driver used (cisco_n1kv).
This patch allows to add more neutron options to enable lbaas, vpnaas, etc...

Change-Id: I7c040519b45b60910778f93b8ffe7a413b4cb6ae
Closes-Bug: #1594388
(cherry picked from commit ec26b43d7b723f02522b9e41d3ee335566574d19)

commit_message:
Ensure appropriate ACL mask is set on CephX keyrings

Changing group permissions alters the ACL mask, causing the "read"
permission we set explicitly for the openstack users to be ignored.

This change ensures "read" is set for the ACLs mask.

Change-Id: I4f94a3f7ab2c55a8c45363b8354be99d52980a7b
Closes-Bug: 1775549
(cherry picked from commit 2a59f98d78a046516d2013308e1be4fa0cf7f068)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 20:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'support reading zuul settings from within a repo

As part of the python3 goal for stein we are going to move the zuul
settings out of the project-config repository and into each project
tree. We need to update the validation to look at the files in the
repo being released in addition to project-config when we are looking
for the project-templates to verify the release jobs.

Change-Id: Ib64d59b1b6646d779112c9fcad47ae7d2c3c74d4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
support reading zuul settings from within a repo

As part of the python3 goal for stein we are going to move the zuul
settings out of the project-config repository and into each project
tree. We need to update the validation to look at the files in the
repo being released in addition to project-config when we are looking
for the project-templates to verify the release jobs.

Change-Id: Ib64d59b1b6646d779112c9fcad47ae7d2c3c74d4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Create network policy handler and driver

This patch adds a base driver and handler for network policy events. Follow up
patches will implement the driver and actions on network policies crud
actions, as well as tempest tests.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies
Co-Authored-By: Eyal Leshem <eyal.leshem@toganetworks.com>

Change-Id: I26969f2597c112259ca90724ff8b357bd8bb376e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 12:37:15.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7b70af34d2df8d0181843a502d3e78ca3c7eb72a
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7b70af34d2df8d0181843a502d3e78ca3c7eb72a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 13:25:49.000000000', 'message': 'Document that nova-compute attaches VIF to active nodes on start up

This can break upgrades if nova-compute is restarted while all
ironic-conductor processes are down. Let us add a warning to
the upgrade documentation.

Change-Id: I914ca0b096f1b320decac9103269afec79ac21f8
'}]
commit_message:
Document that nova-compute attaches VIF to active nodes on start up

This can break upgrades if nova-compute is restarted while all
ironic-conductor processes are down. Let us add a warning to
the upgrade documentation.

Change-Id: I914ca0b096f1b320decac9103269afec79ac21f8

commit_message:
Mark Dell EMC CoprHD Drivers unsupported

The Dell EMC CoprHD drivers have not run 3rd Party CI
in more than 60 days.  This patch marks them
unsupported and they will be removed in Stein
if the 3rd Party CI Issues are not resolved.

Change-Id: I6f6ff82b0f6d9318c7471d1a94c2fa39e9a003c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 13:42:37.000000000', 'message': 'Restore the order of params in ifcfg file that was inadvertently changed

This change to os-net-config in Queens changed the order of the ONBOOT
parameter in the ifcg files created by os-net-config -
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/485132/.  When upgrading a diff is done
between the existing ifcfg files and new data to write.  Since the order
is different, the ifcg files will be detected as different and interfaces,
bridges, etc. will be restarted.  Change the order back to avoid
this from happening.

Change-Id: I77162d28b1dc173e3a90cb385a3af92e21c71574
'}]
commit_message:
Restore the order of params in ifcfg file that was inadvertently changed

This change to os-net-config in Queens changed the order of the ONBOOT
parameter in the ifcg files created by os-net-config -
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/485132/.  When upgrading a diff is done
between the existing ifcfg files and new data to write.  Since the order
is different, the ifcg files will be detected as different and interfaces,
bridges, etc. will be restarted.  Change the order back to avoid
this from happening.

Change-Id: I77162d28b1dc173e3a90cb385a3af92e21c71574

Without this change it will try to update the dhcp-agents on
compute nodes too, which, don't exist.

subject: Change 'Member' role reference to 'member'
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-19 02:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-06-19 11:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 02:46:34.000000000', 'message': "Change 'Member' role reference to 'member'

Keystone has changed the default role during bootstrap from 'Member'
to 'member' therefore the tests which operated under the assumption
of having the 'Member' role assigned are no longer passing.

This patch addresses this issue, however, long term, it's probably
better to create a role and assign it during the test rather than
assuming one already exists, but that's probably for another patch.

Change-Id: I6e4b7665ab046661dd763a1ff8c8e54e6db2dc18
"}]
commit_message:
Change 'Member' role reference to 'member'

Keystone has changed the default role during bootstrap from 'Member'
to 'member' therefore the tests which operated under the assumption
of having the 'Member' role assigned are no longer passing.

This patch addresses this issue, however, long term, it's probably
better to create a role and assign it during the test rather than
assuming one already exists, but that's probably for another patch.

Change-Id: I6e4b7665ab046661dd763a1ff8c8e54e6db2dc18

commit_message:
Start kuryr-kubernetes after creating l7 router

This patch ensures the kuryr-kubernetes service is started after
creating the l7 router, as this was only ensured for the
containerized deployments

Closes-Bug: #1777469
Change-Id: Ia634db2dd7c58b2010483795684e8f776a4f1ee4

commit_message:
Clarify Code-Review 0 etiquette

Make it clear that a submitter ignoring a comment with no vote on a
review probably just missed it, and add contacting them on IRC as
another technique for resolving any miscommunication.

Change-Id: If63212b0b59e5da35d9029cfc0d8b0ac05d4c8f9

commit_message:
Release management chapter updates

The release management chapter failed to take into account a number of
recent policy changes by the Release Team, around available release
models, usage of $PROJECT-stable-maint pre-release[1], or handling of
all official deliverables[2].

This change updates the chapter to the current state of affairs.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128731.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557737/

Change-Id: If45a7577b9ecc88e9a81830c5a4fd9b973a435fc

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: I9ac7b29ea207f1fbe06102c764d0a11dd3d60550
Partial-Bug: #1712399

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:07:12.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6941acb53a22f434947f8b40e6f86b8c14b57d5d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6941acb53a22f434947f8b40e6f86b8c14b57d5d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
ZFSSA handle non-existent snapshot

If a volume snapshot failed during create, it may exist in the database
but not on the ZFSSA. This change allows deletion of such a snapshot.
It also cleans up some redundant code for getting snapshot details.

Change-Id: I522fb0841dfaeb31da3999d3f73a2c9398c5b9c8
Closes-Bug: 1774066
(cherry picked from commit 43263b176cb08e6a71995e12799708831b45b381)

[{'created': '2018-06-19 07:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix docstring which breaks doc generation

Generating the documentation fails because the inherited docstring for
HTTPAdapter.send() gives a warning and warnings are treated as errors.
This patch fixes this by putting a sane docstring for the overridden
method.

Change-Id: Ief6c7964848e4acec29457bc29c327ce161524f7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix docstring which breaks doc generation

Generating the documentation fails because the inherited docstring for
HTTPAdapter.send() gives a warning and warnings are treated as errors.
This patch fixes this by putting a sane docstring for the overridden
method.

Change-Id: Ief6c7964848e4acec29457bc29c327ce161524f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-22 12:03:16.000000000', 'message': "Don't run placement request filters on rebuild

Any enabled placement request filters are processed during scheduling
here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d78055df0e39b53fd481c53429ba77f8c1e1ab09/nova/scheduler/manager.py#L127

But then if we're doing a rebuild, we don't call placement:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d78055df0e39b53fd481c53429ba77f8c1e1ab09/nova/scheduler/manager.py#L132

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d78055df0e39b53fd481c53429ba77f8c1e1ab09/nova/scheduler/manager.py#L135

So we're unnecessarily processing the request spec filters (like
querying the aggregates table) just don't run them on rebuild.

Change-Id: I8ed019c2208c28bb733aac961e855ce77f332a1e
Closes-bug: #1772523
"}, {'created': '2018-05-22 14:19:44.000000000', 'message': "Don't run placement request filters on rebuild

commit_message:
Only run placement request filters when Placement will be called

Any enabled placement request filters are processed during scheduling
here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d78055/nova/scheduler/manager.py#L127

But then if we're doing a rebuild, or the driver.USES_ALLOCATION_CANDIDATES
is False, we don't call placement:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d78055/nova/scheduler/manager.py#L132

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d78055/nova/scheduler/manager.py#L135

So we're unnecessarily processing the request spec filters (like
querying the aggregates table) in those conditions.

Change-Id: I8ed019c2208c28bb733aac961e855ce77f332a1e
Closes-bug: #1772523

[{'created': '2018-06-14 18:39:09.000000000', 'message': 'Update macOS devref info

Mac OS X was renamed to macOS starting with Sierra in 2016. This
updates the development environment information to update the name
and note that unit tests and development are not fully supported
when using this OS.

Includes various doc formatting cleanup as well since I was making
changes to the file.

Change-Id: Ia62ac91add51450dc99c431e9f64732553495558
'}]
commit_message:
Update macOS devref info

Mac OS X was renamed to macOS starting with Sierra in 2016. This
updates the development environment information to update the name
and note that unit tests and development are not fully supported
when using this OS.

Includes various doc formatting cleanup as well since I was making
changes to the file.

Change-Id: Ia62ac91add51450dc99c431e9f64732553495558

[{'created': '2018-06-05 22:22:30.000000000', 'message': "Make it possible to override chrony bindaddress

We still default to kolla_internal_vip_address. However, in some cases
this won't work, such as when kolla_internal_vip_address is a hostname,

Change-Id: I393a2a41ed3bf91f325042cca2310175927bdb40

commit_message:
Make it possible to override chrony bindaddress

We still default to kolla_internal_vip_address. However, in some cases
this won't work, such as when kolla_internal_vip_address is a hostname,
not an IP. This way users can override it in globals.

Change-Id: I393a2a41ed3bf91f325042cca2310175927bdb40

[{'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-12 12:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-12 12:19:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-12 12:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-12 16:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-12 19:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

ok, I will move this to pbr and update.

I was not sure about this solution as well, but do you have any suggestions for different implementation?'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-03-15 19:36:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Could you please wrap the commit message so the reader won't have to scroll left-right? Thanks! ;)"}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-16 10:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-16 10:56:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

note about the outstanding pbr comment from Dmitry - I will work on it once I get more feedback about this solution.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-03-22 11:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

BTW, CI jobs are not passing. Could you fix that please?'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:52:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

> BTW, CI jobs are not passing. Could you fix that please?

The reason why I haven't done this so far as I'm not sure that this is the way to go and looking for some feedback. But I'll take a look what I can do."}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-25 20:05:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-25 21:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

I moved from setuptools to pbr and got rid of one of the CI failures. 

There is still one CI failure regarding requirements, I believe it somehow breaks because I introduced gunicorn requirement. I will continue looking into this. 

Meanwhile, Ilya, if you have some time, can you take a look at the proposed solution and confirm if this bug stays within sushy-tools or solution should be moved to Ironic project. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-03-27 21:42:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Please, update the gunicorn version constraints - CI is failing because of that.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-03-27 22:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-03-28 06:29:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> If gunicorn is needed here, then need to add gunicorn support for sushy-static in Python.

Personally, I'd rather have both tools uniformly based on Flask. It seems more manageable in the long run.

> In order to be able to run several instances on the same machine and pass various arguments I propose this solution: - using systemd instances with different instance names.

Looking at other OpenStack projects [1], it seems that the approach is not to include systemd units with the project at all. Because it is better to generate them at the installation/packaging phase to accommodate the immediate needs.

I am sorry for not pointing that out at the beginning, that realization came to me after I researched how this is being done in other projects.

> This solution might need updates to documentation to make users aware of systemd services.

May be this is actually the way to go: instead of shipping/installing the actual systemd unit files, document them along with the installation procedure so that playbook writers / packagers would benefit from the hints/templates they found in the docs.

WDYT?

1. https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/blob/master/playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/systemd_template.j2"}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-03-30 12:02:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > If gunicorn is needed here, then need to add gunicorn support for
 > sushy-static in Python.
 > 
 > Personally, I'd rather have both tools uniformly based on Flask. It
 > seems more manageable in the long run.
 
I could create another ticket and work on this, but will it not be overhead to use Flask to serve static files? What's the reason why it is not built on Flask already?

 > May be this is actually the way to go: instead of shipping/installing
 > the actual systemd unit files, document them along with the
 > installation procedure so that playbook writers / packagers would
 > benefit from the hints/templates they found in the docs.
 > 
 > WDYT?
 > 
 > 1. https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/blob/master/playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/systemd_template.j2

If this is how it is done in other projects, should stick to this. So the proper solution would be to create a new role in bifrost/playbooks for sushy emulators and add templates there? Or is there other project for playbooks of sushy emulators?

In any case I think this code review should be abandoned as proposed solution is not fit for purpose. Any other proposals will have brand new code reviews."}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-01 07:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this, 
new proposed solution is in new code review - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571645/ 
As the new proposed solution is in different project (sushy, not sushy-tools), new code review was created.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-12 10:13:13.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

restoring this as sushy tools got their own docs and proposed updates belong here better.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-12 10:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I wonder if we should rather put this under `admin` branch as suggested in the docs layout guide [1]...?

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-12 12:18:55.000000000', 'message': 'Make simulators proper system daemons

Added systemd unit files to run simulators as systemd services.
Added to copy systemd unit and configuration files during package installation.

When running sushy-emulator service, then gunicorn is used to serve the application.
At this stage I've chosen that sushy-static service is run without gunicorn, because it serves only static files. If gunicorn is needed here, then need to add gunicorn support for sushy-static in Python (sushy-emulator is Flask app so it works out of the box).

In order to be able to run several instances on the same machine and pass various arguments I propose this solution:
- using systemd instances with different instance names that also serve as instance argument (this way systemd allows to pass only 1 arg). The instance argument is a full file path to a folder that has configuration files for gunicorn, sushy-emulator and sushy-static (this way allowing to pass more than 1 argument to running service instance),
- the solution also includes "default" configuration so that after installation the user can start services without any additional steps (excluding the case of mockup files for sushy-static),
- gunicorn has a lot of arguments, so in systemd unit it passes configuration file where user can put as many arguments as necessary,
- for sushy-static and sushy-emulator all args are passed in one string where user can add args that are necessary. The arg is still saved in config file that systemd uses as EnvironmentFile

Other things that still need consideration:
- is overall approach to this ok
- systemd units use hardcoded location of executables /usr/bin because systemd requires full path. If user installs the package somewhere else, e.g., in --user space, then these systemd files will not work. If this is needed, then the solution needs to be improved to dynamically generate systemd files based on install location.
- does sushy-static need gunicorn
- are systemd unit file values ok, is it necessary to add more configuration for systemd
- is gunicorn default configuration ok
- is sushy-emulator and -static default configuration ok

To try out the change, run
systemctl start sushy-emulator@-etc-sushy\\x2dtools.service
and connect to 127.0.0.1:8000
For sushy-static need to specify location in \etc\sushy-tools\static.conf for -m and then run
systemctl start sushy-static@-etc-sushy\\x2dtools.service
and connect to 127.0.0.1:8001

This solution might need updates to documentation to make users aware of systemd services.

Change-Id: I9405d7f36ecbe742b3402fd09dfa38b9e37121a7
Closes-Bug: #1751571

[{'created': '2018-06-18 13:54:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add splitstack detection to auxilary-facts

The upgrade prepare/converge templates are used for ffu as well. This
change runs the steps for detecting if a splitstack env is in use
in the auxiliary-facts so the splitstack_deployment var is made
available for ffu as well.

Change-Id: I49a34e323cf9479ef387e20b7f831d574a724cd8
'}]
commit_message:
Add splitstack detection to auxilary-facts

The upgrade prepare/converge templates are used for ffu as well. This
change runs the steps for detecting if a splitstack env is in use
in the auxiliary-facts so the splitstack_deployment var is made
available for ffu as well.

Change-Id: I49a34e323cf9479ef387e20b7f831d574a724cd8

subject: support vlan transparent in neutron network
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 09:21:48.000000000', 'message': "support vlan transparent in neutron network

Now, if we use 'neutron net-create' to create a network, which
didn't work, because neutron api can't resolve the parameter
'vlan-transparent'. So we should add 'vlan_tranparent' in
network attributes.

Change-Id: Icb8796f9da5e1d3dab25a61b54d348987d6fd22a
Closes-bug: #1777585
"}]
commit_message:
support vlan transparent in neutron network

Now, if we use 'neutron net-create' to create a network, which
didn't work, because neutron api can't resolve the parameter
'vlan-transparent'. So we should add 'vlan_tranparent' in
network attributes.

Change-Id: Icb8796f9da5e1d3dab25a61b54d348987d6fd22a
Closes-bug: #1777585

commit_message:
Fix failed to remove VIM monitor due to running execution

Mistral recently add the force parameter to delete
non finished executions, therefore, Tacker cannot delete
VIM monitor execution from Mistral.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560802/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561159/

Change-Id: I5b81d220b34b5fb349b71133856ba1202d46d415
Closes-Bug: #1771126

[{'created': '2017-06-22 13:19:40.000000000', 'message': "Separate fedora-atomic image cleanup

The fedora-atomic DIB element[1] can't be used with dracut-regenerate
element as it removes the dracut package at the end of it's
finalise.d/80-fedora-atomic script. Since the dracut-regenerate
requires dracut to be installed in its finalise.d/98-dracut-regenerate
script[2],
the dracut-regenerate element fails to build. The same is true for the
now removed dracut-network element (available in
diskimage-builder < 2.6.0).

This change ensures that the dracut package is removed after it has
been used by the dracut-regenerate element.

With this fix applied, it is still necessary to set the following
environment variables when using dracut-regenerate to inform dracut of
the unusual location of the kernel and ramdisk:

export DIB_BAREMETAL_KERNEL_PATTERN='ostree/fedora-atomic-*/vmlinuz*'
export DIB_BAREMETAL_INITRD_PATTERN='ostree/fedora-atomic-*/initramfs-*'

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/tree/907415c984e95e09a8b872f3c551ae6108c91de1/magnum/drivers/common/image/fedora-atomic
[2] https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/diskimage_builder/elements/dracut-regenerate/finalise.d/98-dracut-regenerate

Change-Id: Iacee381efc12a2d13101871e9472bb80a7fe759a
Closes-Bug: #1699771
"}]
commit_message:
Separate fedora-atomic image cleanup

The fedora-atomic DIB element[1] can't be used with dracut-regenerate
element as it removes the dracut package at the end of it's
finalise.d/80-fedora-atomic script. Since the dracut-regenerate
requires dracut to be installed in its finalise.d/98-dracut-regenerate
script[2],
the dracut-regenerate element fails to build. The same is true for the
now removed dracut-network element (available in
diskimage-builder < 2.6.0).

This change ensures that the dracut package is removed after it has
been used by the dracut-regenerate element.

With this fix applied, it is still necessary to set the following
environment variables when using dracut-regenerate to inform dracut of
the unusual location of the kernel and ramdisk:

export DIB_BAREMETAL_KERNEL_PATTERN='ostree/fedora-atomic-*/vmlinuz*'
export DIB_BAREMETAL_INITRD_PATTERN='ostree/fedora-atomic-*/initramfs-*'

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/tree/907415c984e95e09a8b872f3c551ae6108c91de1/magnum/drivers/common/image/fedora-atomic
[2] https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/blob/master/diskimage_builder/elements/dracut-regenerate/finalise.d/98-dracut-regenerate

Change-Id: Iacee381efc12a2d13101871e9472bb80a7fe759a
Closes-Bug: #1699771

commit_message:
Remove the remaining fake drivers

The following drivers are removed here:
* fake_ilo
* fake_drac
* fake_irmc
* fake_ucs
* fake_cimc
* fake_oneview

Some clean up can be done in the unit tests, but this is out of scope
for this change.

Change-Id: Ifce3f9102384e1424d4ab624d32929f5e832206d

commit_message:
Allow local_mtu to be set to value greater than default (1500)

The neutron global_physnet_mtu must be set to the configured local_mtu
in order to set local_mtu to a value greater than 1500. Otherwise
the neutron configuration will fail during the undercloud install.

Change-Id: Iaadff350a14a2cfb4bf545065f6d12eab49ba125
Closes-Bug: #1774271
(cherry picked from commit 41c401ca65ff32b2a3a1cdd07aabfdcc1bc508ab)

commit_message:
Log the UC deploy/upgrade commands

The command used to deploy/upgrade UC is important to have in logs.
Use warnings as it the minimal required logging level to
always have it logged with openstackclient defaults.

Change-Id: I6d5e6528fc57f4657733eff505fd3bcb151c98f8
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 21657, 'date': '2018-06-18 14:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-06-18 14:53:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 14:53:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new parameter named cache_server_url

If you want to use horizon with a different cacheing backend you
may run into problems. E.g. with redis it expects a database after
the port.
So introducing a new parameter which allows any string as LOCATION
solves this problem and maybe a couple of others.

Change-Id: Ida54599049f69573d27f477c395f14ae0ec26c3c
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new parameter named cache_server_url

If you want to use horizon with a different cacheing backend you
may run into problems. E.g. with redis it expects a database after
the port.
So introducing a new parameter which allows any string as LOCATION
solves this problem and maybe a couple of others.

Change-Id: Ida54599049f69573d27f477c395f14ae0ec26c3c

Change-Id: I0a97c10b4392c288da8ca2e8509f6d568d8df835

commit_message:
VNF in PENDING_SCALE_* status can't be deleted.

when VNF scale process is interrupted by some reasons,
it stays in PENDING_SCALE_IN or PENDING_SCALE_OUT status,
we cannot find it from db with _ACTIVE_UPDATE_ERROR_DEAD status.

Close-Bug: #1777568
Change-Id: I0a97c10b4392c288da8ca2e8509f6d568d8df835

We've discussed the default internally and propose keeping the default as direct_vhd to ease in upgrades (i.e. customers shouldn't be forced to change config before or during an upgrade of Nova) - we can change the default option in future.

The usage of the stream_vdi as the default option is actually what was triggering the UT failures as there is support for stubbing out various glance methods, but not the streaming vdi approach.
We want to look at generally replacing the stub out method and once this is a lot cleaner it will be easier to change the default with the UTs as well."}, {'account_id': 25638, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: Code-Review+1

May 11 03:39:21.413245 dsvm-devstack-citrix-mia-nodepool-1132469 nova-compute[18777]: DEBUG nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [None req-7f868745-1d50-41fb-9a56-f6b1a90ee1f0 tempest-ServerDiskConfigTestJSON-1104465710 tempest-ServerDiskConfigTestJSON-1104465710] [instance: c89fa099-95a9-4e12-840e-42d2229eea9e] Auto configuring disk, attempting to resize root disk... {{(pid=18777) _attach_disks /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py:804}}
May 11 03:39:21.413561 dsvm-devstack-citrix-mia-nodepool-1132469 nova-compute[18777]: DEBUG nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils [None req-7f868745-1d50-41fb-9a56-f6b1a90ee1f0 tempest-ServerDiskConfigTestJSON-1104465710 tempest-ServerDiskConfigTestJSON-1104465710] Skipping auto_config_disk as destination size is 0GB {{(pid=18777) _auto_configure_disk /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py:941}}'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

Disk resize code does not appear to be exercised in Tempest: I believe that the Tempest tests for flavour resize are going from m1.nano to m1.micro - which are both set up by devstack, and both have root_gb=0.
This therefore skips the disk resize code entirely for all hypervisors
(posting to both patches for completeness)'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

"}, {'created': '2017-08-13 00:32:56.000000000', 'message': "WIP: support os_xenapi's VDI streaming

Change-Id: I0ad8e34808401ace9b85e1b937a542f4c4e61690
Depends-On: I2cfe7340d48071bf96bc7ba0ad19f5a0b12b5378
"}, {'created': '2017-08-18 16:27:06.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Support os_xenapi's VDI streaming

The existing glance store need put the image in a stage path firstly so
the XenServer's SR must be file system based (ext or nfs) but can't
support other SR types (lvm, iscsi); and this old way is not an formally
supported way by XenAPI. That may be broken sometime in the future.
this commit creates a new glance store which will using the VDI handler
defined in os-xenapi to handle image downloading/uploading. In this new
method, it will process the images in fly and import/export the image
data to/from VDI in a way formally supported by XenAPI.

This commit also changes the hardcoded image_download_handler to be
configurable so that it's able to be configured to use the new method
for image downloading.

Change-Id: I0ad8e34808401ace9b85e1b937a542f4c4e61690
Depends-On: I2cfe7340d48071bf96bc7ba0ad19f5a0b12b5378
"}, {'created': '2017-08-23 11:00:40.000000000', 'message': "WIP: support os_xenapi's VDI streaming

Change-Id: I0ad8e34808401ace9b85e1b937a542f4c4e61690
Depends-On: I2cfe7340d48071bf96bc7ba0ad19f5a0b12b5378
"}, {'created': '2017-08-25 03:13:59.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: define a new image handler to use vdi streaming

With the new image handler, it creates an image proxy which
will use the vdi streaming function from os-xenapi to
remotely export VHD from XenServer(image upload) or import
VHD from Xenerver(image download).
The existing GlanceStore handles VHD files directly in
XenServer's DomZero, so it has the restriction that SR's
type must be file system based: e.g. ext or nfs. The new
image handler invokes APIs formally supported by XenServer
to export/import VHD remotel, it can support other SR
types also e.g. lvm, iscsi, etc.

Change-Id: I0ad8e34808401ace9b85e1b937a542f4c4e61690
Depends-On: I2cfe7340d48071bf96bc7ba0ad19f5a0b12b5378
Depends-On: I37860e63de32d988525cdc32440fe711777263e6

"}, {'created': '2018-05-10 10:22:09.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: define a new image handler to use vdi streaming

With the new image handler, it creates an image proxy which
will use the vdi streaming function from os-xenapi to
remotely export VHD from XenServer(image upload) or import
VHD to Xenerver(image download).
The existing GlanceStore uses custom functionality to directly
manipulate files on-disk, so it has the restriction that SR's
type must be file system based: e.g. ext or nfs. The new
image handler invokes APIs formally supported by XenServer
to export/import VDI remotely, it can support other SR
types also e.g. lvm, iscsi, etc.

Note:
The function of image handler depends on os-xenapi 0.3.3.

on the patch which bump version in openstack/requirements.

commit_message:
XenAPI: define a new image handler to use vdi streaming

With the new image handler, it creates an image proxy which
will use the vdi streaming function from os-xenapi to
remotely export VHD from XenServer(image upload) or import
VHD to Xenerver(image download).
The existing GlanceStore uses custom functionality to directly
manipulate files on-disk, so it has the restriction that SR's
type must be file system based: e.g. ext or nfs. The new
image handler invokes APIs formally supported by XenServer
to export/import VDI remotely, it can support other SR
types also e.g. lvm, iscsi, etc.

Note:
vdi streaming would be supported by XenServer 6.5 or above.
The function of image handler depends on os-xenapi 0.3.3 or
above, so bump os-xenapi's version to 0.3.3 and also declare
depends on the patch which bump version in openstack/requirements.

Blueprint: xenapi-image-handler-option-improvement
Change-Id: I0ad8e34808401ace9b85e1b937a542f4c4e61690
Depends-On: Ib8bc0f837c55839dc85df1d1f0c76b320b9d97b8

commit_message:
Disable q-agt service for zull v3 rally jobs

It was enabled by default, and it resulted on issues
with ovn-controller and unexpected RPC requests to
neutron-server.

Change-Id: I2a4a4684ee99520e1e5c3094bd37af83180c45b9

commit_message:
tacker conductor service doesn't start after manual installation

The installation instructions for tacker conductor are not
included in the installation manual.

Close-Bug: #1777566
Change-Id: I47b2f76fe7df9b4de229d3bdc95700ad9dc1f99a

commit_message:
Added error handling for discoveryurl

This adds an immediate failure response if the etcd discovery service returns
a bad status code. Before Magnum would continue to run and fail to configure
but with vague information of its failure. This would cause Magnum to generally
wait until the entire timeout before failing.

Change-Id: Iebd51e5dc8a3e3c285cb0c2af35c19f6f37ed0a7
Task: 22193
Story: 2002584

commit_message:
Fix Queens Swift S3 API

Adds new template for Queens that correctly configures
swift3, s3token and proxy pipeline.

Also fixes amulet tests that are currently failing due
to vdb being already mounted in guest and templates
that fail py3.5 due to jinja syntax.

Change-Id: I8ed8a12d2d6adc1f1f3158808101b123ec6bd20d
Closes-Bug: #1775260

commit_message:
Switch service_plugins to firewall_v2

Neutron firewall_v1 is deprecated, and will be removed after Rocky. In
fact, it also looks like it is the cause of failures in Debian.

Therefore, this patch switched to v2.

Change-Id: Ic2f65f534cbcf60738f5b721b967115b223a36f4

subject: Debian: use libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 12:26:00.000000000', 'message': 'Debian: use libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3

Currently, libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 is selected in fixtures/scenario00x.pp
but this is problematic: since the class is called, it is scheduled first
before any Apache WSGI using class is called, resulting in files in
/etc/apache2/sites-available to be deleted before the packages are
installed. Therefore, on the 2nd run, the files are there, and then the
runs are found as non-indempotant.

Therefore, selecting libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 must be done in openstacklib
instead. This also has the advantage that operators wont have to manually
select libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 in their composition scripts.

Change-Id: I2cd52b65929efdb1dc59a09b44d4f54e854adcaf
'}, {'created': '2018-06-13 14:33:57.000000000', 'message': 'Debian: use libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3

Currently, libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 is selected in fixtures/scenario00x.pp
but this is problematic: since the class is called, it is scheduled first
before any Apache WSGI using class is called, resulting in files in
/etc/apache2/sites-available to be deleted before the packages are
installed. Therefore, on the 2nd run, the files are there, and then the
runs are found as non-indempotant.

Therefore, selecting libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 must be done in openstacklib
instead. This also has the advantage that operators wont have to manually
select libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 in their composition scripts.

Change-Id: I2cd52b65929efdb1dc59a09b44d4f54e854adcaf
'}]
commit_message:
Debian: use libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3

Currently, libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 is selected in fixtures/scenario00x.pp
but this is problematic: since the class is called, it is scheduled first
before any Apache WSGI using class is called, resulting in files in
/etc/apache2/sites-available to be deleted before the packages are
installed. Therefore, on the 2nd run, the files are there, and then the
runs are found as non-indempotant.

Therefore, selecting libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 must be done in openstacklib
instead. This also has the advantage that operators wont have to manually
select libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 in their composition scripts.

Change-Id: I2cd52b65929efdb1dc59a09b44d4f54e854adcaf

commit_message:
Debian: do not select libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3

The libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 package selection has to be done in
openstacklib, so we remove this from fixtures scenarios. More info in
that other patch.

Depends-On: I2cd52b65929efdb1dc59a09b44d4f54e854adcaf
Change-Id: I0cf9bbe79e16457016b9e9713056aeac8288f332

[{'created': '2018-03-06 21:18:15.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp: Add use-exact-size parameter when creating a LUN on ONTAP iSCSI

When a cinder volume is created the ontap backend fits the LUN to the
best geometry. It makes the image uploaded from a volume larger than
expected and a volume of larger size must be created from that image.
Using the use-exact-size parameter the backend does not fit to best
geometry, the image uploaded from that volume has the same size and a
volume of the same size may be created from that image.

Nevertheless this parameter is available only in Data ONTAP 9.1 (ontapi
version 1.110) and later.

Closes-Bug: #1731474
Change-Id: I0e21cbcb6effa1e72999580564099976511ca4a9

commit_message:
NetApp: Add use-exact-size parameter when creating a LUN on ONTAP iSCSI

When a cinder volume is created the ontap backend fits the LUN to the
best geometry. It makes the image uploaded from a volume larger than
expected and a volume of larger size must be created from that image.
Using the use-exact-size parameter the backend does not fit to best
geometry, the image uploaded from that volume has the same size and a
volume of the same size may be created from that image.

Nevertheless this parameter is available only in Data ONTAP 9.1 (ontapi
version 1.110) and later.

Closes-Bug: #1731474
Change-Id: I0e21cbcb6effa1e72999580564099976511ca4a9

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I13ed19989321e80771a62ed43cfaaf37a35425bd

commit_message:
SNMPv3 security features added to the `snmp` driver

SNMPv3 message authentication and encryption features
added to Ironic ``snmp`` driver.

Added support for the ``context_engine_id`` and
``context_name`` parameters of the SNMPv3 message
at Ironic's ``snmp`` driver.

The ``snmp_security`` parameter of Ironic ``snmp``
driver is obsoleted by the ``snmp_user`` parameter.
Though ``snmp_security`` parameter remains supported.

For the sake of patch reviewability, it does not touch
similar SNMP features in the `iLO` and `irmc` drivers.
A followup patch might converge these similar SNMP uses
onto the core ``snmp`` driver's functionality this patch
introduces.

Change-Id: Ic8a4fc37a42377c4ec50ffae421b3f47922ef982
Story: 1710850
Task: 10611

commit_message:
EncryptData method use internal Barbican endpoint

The yaql function, _encrypt_data, now specifies the
Barbican endpoint type to be internal.  This is
necessary when TLS is enabled.

Depends-on: Ic89519ed3a9c347a9fff245ec231aa575b42f1ac

Change-Id: I6f10cb33185800c21eff54b1e4cb001f154362d3
Closes-Bug: #1768299

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rabbit params

Remove the deprecated rabbit params which has been deprecated for
two years. The default_transport_url has been present for a while
now and should be used.

Change-Id: I6b239ffca2184f553311428b92cd7043b4289b63

commit_message:
XenAPI: update the document related to vdi streaming

non-FS based Storage Repository will be supported after vdi streaming
patches finished. Remove SR limitation in the document.

Change-Id: Idaf461c849ac28b46e8971e5dd2f0e986a9a5c32

commit_message:
Do not use relation_ids directly

Use a for loop to handle relation_ids for the case when the
relationship has not yet been created.

Change-Id: Ia9cf980591a1bf707f3a1a009229c5f5c222206f
Closes-Bug: #1777508

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 03:36:41.000000000', 'message': "Include authtoken configuration for api

Ie6a6003d667c8c6045439ca3d35f0f121097bddc removed the inclusion of
::mistral::keystone::authtoken in the ::mistral class. This change adds
it to the api configuration which matches what we have for other
modules. Additionally this change add auth_strategy to the api class to
allow users to be able to disable it if they don't want to configuration
keystone.

Change-Id: I68037d0a1f8f43ca40ef6faff119c3fb4b535a90
Closes-Bug: #1777541
"}]
commit_message:
Include authtoken configuration for api

Ie6a6003d667c8c6045439ca3d35f0f121097bddc removed the inclusion of
::mistral::keystone::authtoken in the ::mistral class. This change adds
it to the api configuration which matches what we have for other
modules. Additionally this change add auth_strategy to the api class to
allow users to be able to disable it if they don't want to configuration
keystone.

Change-Id: I68037d0a1f8f43ca40ef6faff119c3fb4b535a90
Closes-Bug: #1777541

commit_message:
Capture logs and install docker in kata-runsh job

This captures the kata, docker, crio, and kubelet logs for the
kata runsh job. We also pre install docker because .ci/setup.sh installs
a version of docker that is too old to pass ci testing :(

Change-Id: I23b9a17dd622b28c7fedc08047190e4a7a0ecd6c

What we often see is:

 2018-06-19 03:28:54.737631 | TASK [validate-host : Collect information about zuul worker]
 2018-06-19 03:28:55.274633 | primary | ERROR
 2018-06-19 03:28:55.275469 | primary | {
 2018-06-19 03:28:55.275587 | primary |   "msg": "No viable v4 or v6 route found to git.openstack.org. The build node is assumed to be invalid."

how a node can be active but not able to see git.openstack.org is a bit of a mystery.  i've put an autohold on to hopefully capture one ...'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-19 04:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

quick links to failure examples

commit_message:
Make fedora jobs non-voting

We're having persistent issues with these nodes starting, leading to
RETRY_LIMIT failures in the gate.  Send to non-voting while we
investigate further.

Change-Id: I2f385f21513f56e902e13602746dab7c4caf6a94

(4 comments)

One thing we need to be clear on. Whether we allow, for a particular node, the ability to have both a serial console AND a VNC console at the same time. I have no idea whether there is a use case for it, but we need to know/design for it if we think it is needed.'}, {'account_id': 136, 'date': '2018-02-21 15:49:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Ruby, one case where we'd potentially be interested in having both open is if there was a console log for historical purposes and occasional VNC access. The log would generally be an open serial console logging the output for support purposes and a VNC for the admins. Not sure if it is worth making the code too complicated at the moment though as this would also need an Ironic serial console log implementation."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 15:54:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Tim: thx for the use case. If we plan for it now, it won't complicate the code at all. If we don't plan for it, it'll be harder to deal with later cuz of backwards compatibility, deprecations, new versions, blah blah, cuz we want the admins out there to love us still :)"}, {'account_id': 136, 'date': '2018-02-21 16:27:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@ruby, happy to help.. we're at 600 servers under Ironic at CERN now and having this change would be great for us so looking foward to helping out with the testing on our 24 different hardware types."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:59:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

as part of this work, there should be a 'no-console' interface implementation, similar to the one we have for serial console (https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/366b29b24f455e321182c96a058df3c2622d690d/setup.cfg#L103)."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 18:34:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I was looking back at previous discussions about the graphical console. I've added links etc to those, in this etherpad: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-rocky-ptg-graphical-console. Please take a look and incorporate what we had agreed upon (or what looks like we had agreed upon...) eg a new interface 'GraphicalConsoleInterface'."}, {'account_id': 19593, 'date': '2018-02-21 19:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Thanks Ruby'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-21 22:38:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Tim, awesome, hopefully we'll have something 'soon' that you could test out! :)"}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-02-22 14:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 11:05:48.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I859649b7f4f9ab70617309947375d4886e14a860
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I859649b7f4f9ab70617309947375d4886e14a860

commit_message:
Add nfs as a cinder backup driver option to CinderBackupBackend

Added nfs as an option to where CinderBackupBackend was hardcoded
as either ceph or swift. Also added some parameters for this
driver - CinderBackupNfsShare and CinderBackupNfsMountOptions

Depends-On: Ic0adb294aa2e60243f8adaf167bdd75e42c8e20e
Change-Id: I29a488374726676a28fb82f2f950db891fcf9627
Closes-Bug: #1744174
(cherry picked from commit e456e103fbfb5d7dd12f4dcbee4fd6686384117c)

[{'created': '2018-04-26 18:44:09.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using needed_by field in resource

During the original prototype development, I missed the fact that the
`needed_by` field of a resource is no longer needed for the actual
convergence algorithm:

https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/commit/c74aac1f07e3fdf1fe382a7edce6c4828eda13e3

Since nothing is using this any more, we can avoid an unnecessary DB
write to every resource at the start of a stack update. For now, just
write an empty list to that field any time we are storing the resource.
In future, we can stop reading/writing the field altogether, and in a
subsequent release we could drop the column from the DB.

commit_message:
Stop using needed_by field in resource

During the original prototype development, I missed the fact that the
`needed_by` field of a resource is no longer needed for the actual
convergence algorithm:

https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/commit/c74aac1f07e3fdf1fe382a7edce6c4828eda13e3

Since nothing is using this any more, we can avoid an unnecessary DB
write to every resource at the start of a stack update. For now, just
write an empty list to that field any time we are storing the resource.
In future, we can stop reading/writing the field altogether, and in a
subsequent release we could drop the column from the DB.

Change-Id: I0c9c77f395db1131b16e5bd9d579a092033400b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 18:44:09.000000000', 'message': "Calculate convergence required_by from graph in Stack

In convergence, resources can continue to exist in the database that are
no longer part of the latest template. When calling
Resource.required_by() for such resources, we still want to get a list
of those resources that depend on them. Previously we did this using the
`needed_by` field in the resource. Since this is the only actual use of
needed_by, get the information from the Stack's convergence graph
instead (which is generated from the resources' `requires` field and
ignores `needed_by`). This eliminates any risk that the `requires` and
`needed_by` fields get out of sync, and allows us to get rid of
`needed_by` altogether in the future.

Change-Id: I64e1c66817151f39829d5c54b0a740c56ea8edad
"}, {'created': '2018-04-26 21:26:47.000000000', 'message': "Calculate convergence required_by from graph in Stack

In convergence, resources can continue to exist in the database that are
no longer part of the latest template. When calling
Resource.required_by() for such resources, we still want to get a list
of those resources that depend on them. Previously we did this using the
`needed_by` field in the resource. Since this is the only actual use of
needed_by, get the information from the Stack's convergence graph
instead (which is generated from the resources' `requires` field and
ignores `needed_by`). This eliminates any risk that the `requires` and
`needed_by` fields get out of sync, and allows us to get rid of
`needed_by` altogether in the future.

Change-Id: I64e1c66817151f39829d5c54b0a740c56ea8edad
"}, {'created': '2018-06-14 23:35:39.000000000', 'message': "Calculate convergence required_by from graph in Stack

In convergence, resources can continue to exist in the database that are
no longer part of the latest template. When calling
Resource.required_by() for such resources, we still want to get a list
of those resources that depend on them. Previously we did this using the
`needed_by` field in the resource. Since this is the only actual use of
needed_by, get the information from the Stack's convergence graph
instead (which is generated from the resources' `requires` field and
ignores `needed_by`). This eliminates any risk that the `requires` and
`needed_by` fields get out of sync, and allows us to get rid of
`needed_by` altogether in the future.

Change-Id: I64e1c66817151f39829d5c54b0a740c56ea8edad
"}]
commit_message:
Calculate convergence required_by from graph in Stack

In convergence, resources can continue to exist in the database that are
no longer part of the latest template. When calling
Resource.required_by() for such resources, we still want to get a list
of those resources that depend on them. Previously we did this using the
`needed_by` field in the resource. Since this is the only actual use of
needed_by, get the information from the Stack's convergence graph
instead (which is generated from the resources' `requires` field and
ignores `needed_by`). This eliminates any risk that the `requires` and
`needed_by` fields get out of sync, and allows us to get rid of
`needed_by` altogether in the future.

Change-Id: I64e1c66817151f39829d5c54b0a740c56ea8edad

commit_message:
Stop logging API not found as ERROR

Currently if the user requests and object that is not found the API
will log this as an "ERRROR" level message.
This patch changes this to be a debug message as lookup of objects
that have been deleted is a normal occurrence.

Change-Id: I4e0db4b05b8636c40a62928e0b462ae73236eea0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 19:40:38.000000000', 'message': "Limit .zuul.yaml gate jobs to most important jobs only

This patchset limits the jobs enqueued in the gate pipeline in
Zuul to the 2 most important jobs only:

- patrole-admin
- patrole-member

Everything else will remain in the check pipeline. This means
that the chances of errant gate failures will be significantly
reduced. At the same time, test coverage will remain the same.
Now, however, all jobs will run once during the check pipeline
(when commits are first submitted) and, after cores approve
of a patchset, only the 2 jobs above (in addition to unit test
jobs, pep8, etc.) will run [0].

It is extremely unlikely that a patchset B that is merged between
patchset A's check and gate pipelines will cause a breaking change
to enter the source code -- and even so, this is an acceptable
margin of error when balanced against developer workflow being
slowed down in some cases severely due to many, many spurious
failures across volume and server APIs related to driver instability
(not RBAC), across multiple jobs enqueued in the gate pipeline.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/zuul.html

Change-Id: I57772e00d4e96a8ac841651b7f36379629940956

commit_message:
Limit .zuul.yaml gate jobs to most important jobs only

This patchset limits the jobs enqueued in the gate pipeline in
Zuul to the 2 most important jobs only:

- patrole-admin
- patrole-member

Everything else will remain in the check pipeline. This means
that the chances of errant gate failures will be significantly
reduced. At the same time, test coverage will remain the same.
Now, however, all jobs will run once during the check pipeline
(when commits are first submitted) and, after cores approve
of a patchset, only the 2 jobs above (in addition to unit test
jobs, pep8, etc.) will run [0].

It is extremely unlikely that a patchset B that is merged between
patchset A's check and gate pipelines will cause a breaking change
to enter the source code -- and even so, this is an acceptable
margin of error when balanced against developer workflow being
slowed down in some cases severely due to many, many spurious
failures across volume and server APIs related to driver instability
(not RBAC), across multiple jobs enqueued in the gate pipeline.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/zuul.html

Change-Id: I57772e00d4e96a8ac841651b7f36379629940956

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 17:03:48.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor wait_for_scrubber_shutdown function

The wait_for_scrubber_shutdown function catches AssertionErrors
and retries.  Refactor it so that it only retries for a specific
error (namely, when glance scrubber is running in daemon mode when
the test is being executed) by changing the function so that it
returns values instead of relying on test assertions in the
function passed to it.  Also refactor the tests that call
wait_for_scrubber_shutdown so that they check the returned results
instead of using assertions in the function they pass to
wait_for_scrubber_shutdown.

This is a follow-up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566681/

Change-Id: I7108179e0d96e09638ff783b029a8216f0938c3b

commit_message:
Refactor wait_for_scrubber_shutdown function

The wait_for_scrubber_shutdown function catches AssertionErrors
and retries.  Refactor it so that it only retries for a specific
error (namely, when glance scrubber is running in daemon mode when
the test is being executed) by changing the function so that it
returns values instead of relying on test assertions in the
function passed to it.  Also refactor the tests that call
wait_for_scrubber_shutdown so that they check the returned results
instead of using assertions in the function they pass to
wait_for_scrubber_shutdown.

This is a follow-up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566681/

Change-Id: I7108179e0d96e09638ff783b029a8216f0938c3b
Closes-bug: #1768077

subject: Use group_regex to serialize scrubber tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-30 19:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-30 19:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-30 20:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-30 20:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

That seems to be doing the trick. All of the serial tests are being run in worker 5 in http://logs.openstack.org/86/571286/2/check/openstack-tox-functional/3c2a42d/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-30_20_17_14_341393 and worker 0 in http://logs.openstack.org/86/571286/2/check/openstack-tox-functional-py35/86d1081/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-30_20_16_56_847636'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-05-30 21:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- tempest-full: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1763070

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-05-31 11:57:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

First, thanks to Zane for taking an interest in the glance test configuration and putting up this patch.

I've got mixed feelings about this change.  I like the fact that it has a single run instead of combining two runs.  I don't like that the group-regex is hidden away in the .stester config file.  The current setup, ugly as it is, it pretty much in-your-face about what's going on.  My concern is that we have a really small team, and the test jobs get set up once and then aren't looked at for a long time, so I have a preference for in-your-face configuration.  Let's see what other glance cores think."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-05-31 11:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

tempest failure is unrelated to this patch'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-05-31 11:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-31 13:26:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't like that the group-regex is hidden away in the .stester config file.

You can also pass it as a --group-regex option on the CLI (after `stestr` and before `run`) if that's what floats your boat :) Feel free to update the patch."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-06 17:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ice8e114c6590b25f3ec79fbe4c06efaa245706c0 was approved anyway, so I guess nobody cares?'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-06-06 20:32:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Zane: i think it was more a hurry to get the failing py35 test merged.  I don't think people have had time to think about this patch yet. commit_message:
Use group_regex to serialize scrubber tests

Instead of doing two separate test runs, use the group_regex option to
stestr to group tests that cannot be run in parallel into the same
worker.

Change-Id: I3d69d5c72d69484f4e1c9c0b11122d0cf3703d60
Related-Bug: #1768077

commit_message:
Fix logo in IE11/Edge browsers

IE11/Edge browsers doesn't scale SVG images correct if
weight and height is specified directly in SVG. Also these
browsers doesn't work well with max-height style.

Change-Id: I3fe643dd5e0d47cb0e5a658c84d23a8750c217e7
Closes-Bug: #1715674
(cherry picked from commit 502cffb1f8d2f476cff682e6aba15f71ee49c3ef)

Commit 3ab0be1f3eccf2197c06f73fb740fac18e22097e introduced some
DSL reworking, but in once case where attribution() was called, it

commit_message:
Fix Error: attribution() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given)

Commit 3ab0be1f3eccf2197c06f73fb740fac18e22097e introduced some
DSL reworking, but in once case where attribution() was called, it
hadn't been updated.

This commit adds a missing parameter to the function, which appears
to fix the issue.

Change-Id: I9319430af002de3d85e74b9713624b7b2ea1ab2f
Closes-Bug: #1776601

commit_message:
Method, decrypt_data, uses internal Barbican endpoint

The yaql function, decrypt_data, in the file, yaql_functions.py,
sets the config option, barbican_endpoint_type, to internal.
This allows Murano to work when TLS is enabled.

Change-Id: Id9d82d7bbedcef87bdc9865ec55511d4e1f65507
Closes-Bug: #1775035

commit_message:
Change catch type for workflow unregister

Since _cls_registry is now a list, removing a non-existing
element throws a ValueError instead of a KeyError.
This did not result in the desired NotRegistered exception.

Change-Id: I2ae7381ce65a0c8fa7deed2c08bfc51e1685f09e
Closes-Bug: 1776187

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-18 11:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-06-18 12:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-06-18 12:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-18 13:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-18 15:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 11:54:23.000000000', 'message': 'Log memcached to stdout/err only

Memcached logging configuration is not friendly.
We cannot use configuration options as they seemed to be
ignored because of a bug. We cannot use redirection >>
as this breaks logrotate signalling SIGHUP to processes
and expecting them to handle the open file descriptors
associated with truncated/removed logfiles - this does
not work with redirected output into a file.

The only option is not log memcached into a file. There is
not much of actual value in the log. Keep it logging to
stdout/stderr in its container, which will get captured in
the docker logs (and journald via the logging backend).

Co-authored-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovat@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1776889

Change-Id: I3b5aec6b7f7c5fa4f84e3c3eb243c155a6189e2c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-18 12:28:05.000000000', 'message': 'Log memcached to stdout/err only

Memcached logging configuration is not friendly.
We cannot use configuration options as they seemed to be
ignored because of a bug. We cannot use redirection >>
as this breaks logrotate signalling SIGHUP to processes
and expecting them to handle the open file descriptors
associated with truncated/removed logfiles - this does
not work with redirected output into a file.

The only option is not log memcached into a file. There is
not much of actual value in the log. Keep it logging to
stdout/stderr in its container, which will get captured in
the docker logs (and journald via the logging backend).

Co-authored-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovat@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1776889

(cherry picked from commit f43deec168f40835a8824ae88c6b3469af9f61d7)

Change-Id: I3b5aec6b7f7c5fa4f84e3c3eb243c155a6189e2c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Log memcached to stdout/err only

Memcached logging configuration is not friendly.
We cannot use configuration options as they seemed to be
ignored because of a bug. We cannot use redirection >>
as this breaks logrotate signalling SIGHUP to processes
and expecting them to handle the open file descriptors
associated with truncated/removed logfiles - this does
not work with redirected output into a file.

The only option is not log memcached into a file. There is
not much of actual value in the log. Keep it logging to
stdout/stderr in its container, which will get captured in
the docker logs (and journald via the logging backend).

Co-authored-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovat@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1776889

(cherry picked from commit f43deec168f40835a8824ae88c6b3469af9f61d7)

Change-Id: I3b5aec6b7f7c5fa4f84e3c3eb243c155a6189e2c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for Watcher

Provide support for kolla dev mode in Watcher. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'watcher_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Watcher project is cloned
and bind mounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I104c010a8308607b68fc8c7352a0511d16f06fb5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-16 03:19:20.000000000', 'message': 'Retrieve hosts under initAction

In before, the UI tried to call Zun API to retrieve the list of
hosts at the top level. However, if the user is not login, the Zun
API call will return 401 which causes error on loading the page.

Change-Id: I4af881d38a721a1e70610440e0fba416eab85f41
'}]
commit_message:
Retrieve hosts under initAction

In before, the UI tried to call Zun API to retrieve the list of
hosts at the top level. However, if the user is not login, the Zun
API call will return 401 which causes error on loading the page.

Change-Id: I4af881d38a721a1e70610440e0fba416eab85f41
